name: Apple Irish Coffee
directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Pour Baileys, iced coffee, apple brandy, and Yellow Chartreuse over ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Woo Woo #2
directions: Combine ingredients into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Vampire Vixen
directions: Combine all ingredients in tall chilled glass with ice.

name: The Shamrock-tini
tags: baileys with a hint of milk chocolate
ingredients: Baileys with a Hint of Milk Chocolate
directions: Add Baileys with a hint of Mint Chocolate and vodka to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Sweet and Spooky Creamsicle
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled martini glass. Serve with candy corn and rock candy swizzle stick.

name: Sultry Samantha
directions: Shake with ice and strain over fresh ice in a highball or cocktail glass. Garnish with an apple slice or cinnamon stick.
*Simple syrup: 1 part water & 2 parts organic cane sugar brought to a boil in a sauce pan and cooled.

name: Shamrock #2
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake well and pour into an old-fashioned glass.

name: September Spice
directions: Muddle all ingredients together, add ice, shake well and strain into an old fashioned glass over fresh ice.  Garnish with a Habanero slice.

name: Proper Irish Whiskey
directions: No ice. Serve in a tumbler.

name: Peppermint Froth
directions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice and garnish with a chocolate-covered peppermint candy stick. If you’re feeling decadent, top with whipped cream and crushed candy canes.

name: Mexican Hot Chocolate #2
ingredients: Silver tequila (this recipe uses Hornitos Plata)
directions: Warm the milk and chocolate in a saucepan. Stir with a whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture begins to boil. Remove from the heat and froth the chocolate with a whisk.
Add one part Hornitos Plata for every five parts of hot chocolate. Finish with dollop of whipped cream.

name: Herradura Mango Mojito
directions: Muddle the mint leaves, sugar and lime juice in the bottom of a tall glass. Add Herradura and mango juice. Add a splash of club soda and ice cubes. Serve with a mint leaf garnish.

name: Green Agave
directions: In a shaker filled with ice add tequila, melon liqueur and lime. Shake for 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a shamrock carved lime (optional).

name: Godchild
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Everybody’s Irish
directions: Add the whiskey, chartreuse and crème de menthe and bitters in a shaker filled with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled martini glass.

name: Dubonnet Cocktail
directions: Add a few ice cubes to a mixing glass. Pour in Dubonnet and gin. Mix gently and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Absinthe Irish
directions: Shake well in a shaker filled with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: 2-Point Play
directions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with an apple wedge.

name: Apple Berry Crush
directions: Use a large martini glass. Fill blender with liquors and ice, top off with cranberry and orange juice. Blend until ice is crushed and almost smooth. Garnish rim of glass with sugar and add an apple slice and raspberry and enjoy!

name: Apple Sidecar (Apple Car)
ingredients: apple brandy, Calvados, or Apple Jack
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake well and strain into a martini glass.

name: Anti-Oxidant Cocktail
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a few fresh blueberries.

name: Apple Bob
directions: Rim a cocktail glass with cinnamon sugar. Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into the cocktail glass. Garnish with an apple slice.

name: Apple Pie Shot
directions: Pour apple juice into mouth, followed by the Captain Morgan. Top it off with some whipped cream and cinnamon. Close mouth and swish and swallow!

name: Apple Irish Coffee
directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Pour Baileys, iced coffee, apple brandy, and Yellow Chartreuse over ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Aphrodisiac
directions: Muddle and strain 4–5 strawberries. Add strawberry juice with pomegranate juice, pressed apple juice, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker. Add Rémy Martin V.S.O.P. and ice. Shake well and strain into an ice- and sliced strawberry-filled highball glass.

name: Amore Appletini
directions: Put all ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with an apple slice. Dean says, “You will not believe the flavor the ginger adds to this drink.”

name: Ancholito Luxury Drop
directions: Cut the watermelon into small, flat triangles with the rind forming the smallest edge. Put the cocoa powder in one bowl or plate and the ancho chili powder in another bowl or plate. Cut the lime and use it to moisten one half of the edge of a shot glass or other small, fluted glass. Dip the moistened edge into the cocoa powder and fill the glass with the Don Julio Añejo. Dip the pointed end of the watermelon slice in the ancho chile powder and toast with the “drop” (“salud”). Bite and chew the chile-coated watermelon to mix those flavors in your mouth, and then lick the cocoa from the rim and wash it all down with the Don Julio Añejo, allowing all of the flavors to mix in your mouth before swallowing.

name: Anna’s Summer Shot
directions: Combine everything in a shaker and shake vigorously with ice. Pour into a shot glass. Shoot, repeat.

name: American Flyer
directions: Combine all but champagne with ice in a shaker and shake well. Strain into chilled collins of hurricane glass. Fill with champagne.

name: American Sweetheart
directions: Shake with ice. Serve in a rocks glass.

name: American Pie
directions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Pour in Malibu lime juice and grenadine. Top with 7 Up, Sprite, or other lemon-lime soda. Stir well.

name: Zombie Peep Corpse Reviver
ingredients: dry gin (we like Bluecoat or Aviation)
orange liqueur (for example, Cointreau or Patron Citronge)
1 formerly living bunny Peep in the throes of being eaten
directions: Combine the first five ingredients in a pint glass with ice and shake well. Pour into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with Peeps as appropriate

name: Zen Latte
directions: Stir and garnish with matcha powder, a fine-ground form of green tea.

name: Zombie
directions: In a blender, combine all ingredients except the 151 with crushed ice.Â
Blend at a high speed until smooth and pour into a Collins glass. Float the 151 rum on top and garnish with the orange slice and maraschino cherry.

name: Zombie – Don the Beachcomer 1934
directions: Put everything in blender, saving ice for last. Blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds. Pour into glass and add ice cubes to fill. Garnish with a mint sprig.
DOTW suggestion would be to also stir the ingredients.
*Donn’s Mix
Ingredients:
3 cinnamon sticks, crushed
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
Fresh grapefruit juice
Directions:

Create an infused simple syrup by heating cinnamon sticks, sugar and water. Bring to a boil, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Simmer for 2 minutes, then remove from heat and let sit for at least 2 hours before straining into a clean glass bottle. To finish making the mix, add 1 part of the syrup to 2 parts fresh grapefruit juice.

name: Yuletide Punch
ingredients: 2 whole red apple cut in slices
directions: Mix all ingredients in large bowl and garnish with seasonal fruit slices. Makes 16 servings.

name: Zesty Irishman
directions: In a mixing tin half-filled with ice, add:
¾ oz. Drambuie
1 oz. Irish Whiskey
¼ oz. Triple Sec
Juice of ½ Lemon
Shake until the tin is frosted, strain into a rocks glass filled with ice, add:
Splash Ginger Ale
Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Zapatista
directions: Beginning with agave nectar and pepper, combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain over fresh ice into tall glass. Garnish with long grapefruit peel.

name: Yoshi
directions: Mix in a shaker with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Yokohama Mama
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Yellow Parrot
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Yellow Bird #1
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and pour into an old fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Yellow Fingers
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Yellow Bird #2
directions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice and stir.

name: Yellow Morning
directions: Layer this drink by pouring the crème de banane slowly into a parfait glass, pour the cherry herring slowly over the back of a spoon on top of the crème de banane and then pour the cognac slowly over the back of a spoon on top of the cherry herring.

name: Yankee Doodle
directions: Muddle grapes, ginger, and sugar in pint glass. Add ice and SKYY Infusions Grape Vodka. Shake vigorously and strain into cocktail glass over fresh ice. Top with soda and garnish with raspberries & blueberries!

name: Yale Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: XOXO
directions: Combine ingredients in shaker. Strain and serve in a martini glass.

name: X-Tea-C
directions: Build drink in collins glass and garnish with lemongrass.

name: Xanthia
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: XYZ Cocktail #2
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Xango
directions: Combine ingredients except the lemon peel in shaker, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass, or combine the ingredients in a blender with one cup of ice, blend 15–20 seconds until smooth and pour into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: XYZ Cocktail #1
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: X-Rated Summer
directions: Muddle fresh basil, lemon and watermelon. Add ice, X-Rated Fusion and shake. Strain into champagne flute and top with prosecco or dry sparkling wine or soda.

name: X on the Peach
directions: Mix ingredients into a pink glass and shake over ice. Strain and serve in a chilled martini glass.

name: X-Rated Mimosa Royale
ingredients: 1/3 glass of champagne or sparkling wine
X-Rated Fusion liqueur poured on top

name: X-Rated Flirtini
directions: Combine with ice in a shaker. Pour into a martini glass. Garnish with lemon or whatever you have and is fun.

name: X Meeting Mrs. Bing
tags: Movie and TV MILFs and their Cocktails
directions: Mix ingredients into a pink glass and shake over ice. Strain and serve in a chilled martini glass.

name: Wreath of Barbs
directions: In a shaker filled with ice, add the vodka and juices. Mix well and serve in a highball glass over ice.

name: Woodstock
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Woo Woo #2
directions: Combine ingredients into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Woo Woo
directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Combine ingredients and shake well, strain into a cocktail shaker. Can also be served as a shooter. In that case reduce liquors to 3/4 oz each and the Cranberry to 1/2 oz serve in a rocks glass.

name: Witch’s Brew #2
directions: Combine Godiva Chocolate Raspberry Infused Vodka and Crème de Cassis in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into a champagne flute. Top off drink with chilled champagne.

name: Witch’s Punch
directions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled highball glass. Garnish with blueberries and serve.

name: Witches Brew #3
ingredients: As many silly straws as desired
directions: Fill a large goblet (or large glass) with ice and add Caliche Rum, Dark Rum, Bacardi 151, Pineapple Juice, Lime Juice, Simple Syrup and Grenadine. Use a bar spoon to stir the drink until all of the ingredients are combined, creating a pinkish red color. Throw in a handful of gummy worms and the appropriate amount of silly straws needed for sharing.

name: Witch’s Brew
directions: Combine Champagne and orange juice in large punch bowl. Scoop sherbet into bowl until it has produced a nice scum over the top. Add sugar to taste if desired. Float peeled grapes in mixture, and garnish bowl with the rest of the grapes. Drop in pieces of dry ice for steaming effect, but note that no one should put dry ice in his/her mouth. If you want to raise or lower the alcohol content in the punch, add vodka, or clear soda respectively.

name: Winter Wonderland
directions: Shake and Strain.
APPROX CALORIES: 150

name: Winter Sour
directions: In a mixing glass, strip the leaves of 2 inches of rosemary and muddle lightly. Add the Meyer lemon juice and egg white and dry shake for 5 seconds. Add the Campari and honey syrup and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain up. No garnish.

name: Winter Cherry Punch
directions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Shake ingredients and serve over crushed ice

name: Wild Irish Rose
directions: Fill in highball glass with ice. Add Tullamore Dew, grenadine and lime juice. Stir well. Fill with club soda.

name: Winter Blanco Martini
directions: Rub the rim of a chilled margarita glass with the lime wedge, then dip in a saucer of coarse salt to frost. Place the cracked ice cubes into a cocktail shaker. Pour the Frida Kahlo tequila blanco, triple sec and lime juice over the ice. Shake vigorously until a frost forms. Strain into your prepared glasses and decorate with a lime slice.

name: Wicky Wacky Woo
directions: Combine all ingredients with ice and pour into a hurricane or parfait glass. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry.

name: Wild Turkey American Honey Wild Mustang
directions: Combine American Honey, grapefruit juice and bitters in a tumbler with ice and stir. Strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

name: Widow’s Kiss
directions: Combine everything in a shaker with ice. Mix well and stain in to a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Wicked Witch Apple Punch
ingredients: 1 750 ml bottle Skyy Infusions Passion Fruit
directions: Combine all ingredients in a large black witch’s cauldron with ice and stir. Garnish with large slices of red apple floating on top and dry ice.

name: Wicked Sky
directions: In a shaker with ice, add the scotch and melon liqueur. Shake well and pour ice and all into a highball glass. Fill with pineapple juice. Enjoy!

name: Wicked Red Punch
directions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and let sit, refrigerated for at least an hour before. If available,  add one large block of ice to the bowl. Stir well before serving and garnish glass with a sugar rim and orange slice.

name: White Russian
directions: Combine first two ingredients over ice in a rocks glass, float cream on top.

name: Who Needs Her
directions: Combine all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Who Needs Him
directions: In a shaker, muddle one piece of fresh ginger. Add ice and all ingredients. Shake and strain over fresh ice. Top with club soda and garnish with a lime twist.

name: White Cosmopolitan
ingredients: Ocean Spray white cranberry juice cocktail
directions: Combine all ingredients, except garnish, in a cocktail shaker. Pour into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lime twist or a skewer of fresh cranberries if desired.

name: Whiskey Sour
directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice, and build in the glass. Add a stir straw and a lemon twist.

name: Whiskey Sencha
ingredients: 1.5oz Homemade Sencha greentea mint syrup. (Enrich Loose leaf Sencha was used)
directions: Combine all ingredients into a pint glass, add 4 ice cubes and shake moderately. Strain over new ice and add mint sprig garnish

name: Watermelon #1
directions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice and stir.

name: What’s Up, Doc? Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into cocktail glass over ice. Optional: Sprinkle some cinnamon on top.

We juiced some carrots ourselves and used Beefeater 24 gin and Domaine de Canton ginger liqueur. We chose this gin is a little less dry than some other brands. You can substitute store-bought carrot juice and your favorite brands and adjust to taste if needed.

name: Watermelon Mojito
directions: Cut the watermelon into cubes and measure out 1 1/2 cups. Combine the watermelon, lime juice, mint leaves, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker. Thoroughly muddle the mixture until the watermelon is mostly liquid. Add the rum and some ice cubes. Shake. Next, fill a glass most of the way up with crushed ice. Strain the watermelon mixture into the glass. Top with club soda.

name: Watermelon and Apple Margarita
directions: Place all liquid ingredients in a Boston glass or a shaker. Shake hard and strain in to an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with an apple fan and enjoy!

name: Watermelon Agua Fresca Margarita
ingredients: 3 medium size pieces of fresh watermelon, muddled
directions: In a mixing glass, muddle watermelon and basil. Add other ingredients, ice and shake 10 to 12 times. Pour into a margarita glass filled with ice.

name: Watermelon #3
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.

name: Washington Apple
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well and pour into a shot glass. Multiply measurements to make multiple shooters.

name: Warsaw Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Warm Winter Margarita
directions: Combine apple juice and cinnamon in a heavy pot. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove cinnamon stick carefully. Add sugar, dried fruit, and tequila. Mix well. Serve warm. Serves 4.

name: Waldorf Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Voodoo Daiquiri
directions: Combine bourbon, vodka, grape juice and ice into a blender and blend at a medium speed until smooth (15 to 25 seconds). Pour into a chilled highball or collins glass. Should be served in a plastic cup while in the French Quarter.

name: Vodka Stinger
directions: Combine in a highball glass filled with ice, stir.

name: Volga Boatman
directions: Combine vodka, kirschwasser and orange juice in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with maraschino cherry.

name: Vodka Mimosa (Champagne Screw)
directions: Pour in a chilled champagne glass.

name: Vodka Ice Cream Soda
directions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.

name: Vodka Gimlet
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve with a lime squeeze.

name: Vesper
directions: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. You can shake or you can stir. A shaken drink will be a little colder. A stirred drink will be a little stronger. The drink is served up (with no ice).

name: Vieux Carre
directions: Fill a glass halfway with ice, then pour in ingredients. Stir well. Garnish with a lemon twist.
More New Orleans Cocktails for Mardi Gras.

name: Via Veneto
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Very Old Fashioned
directions: Stir a shot of Bols with a dash of bitters and a small amount of muscovado sugar, using large, cold, hard ice cubes. While still stirring, keep adding ice and tasting, until you reach the desired point of ice dilution, sugar solutions and flavor. Garnish with orange peel.

name: Very Merry Cocoa
ingredients: crème de menthe (white or green, your choice—I like green)
directions: Mix the liquors together in a glass or shaker first. Make cocoa as you normally would (leaving out some of the water/milk), then dump the liquor mix in on top, and stir. It’s cocoa with a pretty strong kick, but the mini-marshmallows can make you feel like a kid again. Just don’t let the kids confuse the drinks!

name: Vanilla Peppermint Martini
directions: Crush your choice of candy canes to rim the martini glasses. If you don’t want to rim with crushed candy canes, then just dangle a miniature candy cane on the rim of each glass.

name: Vegas Phone Call
directions: Shake and strain into a highball with fresh ice. Top with Champagne.

name: Vanilla Coke
directions: Pour the vodka into a collins glass filled with ice and fill with coke.

name: Vanity Fair
directions: Combine brandy, kirschwasser and maraschino liqueur in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Float amaretto on top.

name: Vancouver Cocktail
ingredients: ½ egg white (powdered egg whites can be used if you are concerned about salmonella)
directions: Combine everything in the tin side of a Boston Shaker. Don’t add ice yet. Use a stick blender or a cappuccino frother get the eggs whites started. Blend lightly for about 20 seconds. Add a scoop of ice and shake well (20–30 seconds) and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
If you are brave, flame an orange peel into the drink to release the oils and float it.

name: Vanderbilt Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Vampire’s Punch
directions: Wash and remove pits and stems from fresh cherries, and muddle in cocktail shaker. Combine the rest of the ingredients except 7 Up in bowl and stir. Top with 7 Up and muddled cherries. Serves 12.

name: Van Gogh’s Garden
ingredients: Garnish: muddled cucumber, kiwi fruit on the bottom, kiwi wheel on rim
directions: Muddle two cucumber wheels & two peeled kiwi wheels with the simple syrup in a double rocks glass. Fill with ice and add the Lucid absinthe. Top with club soda and add an un-peeled kiwi wheel on the rim.

name: Vampire’s Kiss
ingredients: 1 Pinch of Salt for the glass rim

name: Vampire’s Elixir
directions: Dress strawberry syrup on the inside and rim of a chilled martini glass. Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into martini glass. Garnish with vampire teeth.

name: Vampire’s Kiss
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a collins or other tall glass.

name: Vampire Kiss
directions: Shake with ice, strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with seasonal fruit. (We used a black cherry.)

name: Vampire Vixen
directions: Combine all ingredients in tall chilled glass with ice.

name: Vampire Blood
directions: Muddle fresh raspberry, lime wedges, plum purée and simple syrup in pint glass with ice. Add Skyy Infusions Raspberry and shake vigorously. Strain into a gold rimmed coupe glass. Garnish with lime and raspberry.

name: Vampire Ritual
directions: Muddle blueberries and syrup together, then pour mixture and all other ingredients into cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into martini glass. For garnish, use a lemon slice colored with beets.
For syrup: Boil equal parts water and sugar along with several slices of raw beet and small handful of blueberries. Strain out solids and let liquid cool before use.

name: Valentini
directions: Shake and strain into a martini glass, garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Valentine’s Kiss
directions: Combine ingredients in collins glass and top with club with club soda. Garnish with lime and cherry.

name: UV Vampire Kiss
directions: Shake vodka and pineapple juice with ice; strain into martini glass. Garnish with red currants.

name: Valencia Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Urquhart Castle
ingredients:
Scotch
oz.
Dashes Dry Vermouth
Dashes Cointreau
Dashed Orange Bitters
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and pour into a chilled old fashioned glass.

name: Updated Nog Martini
directions: Combine in a mixing glass with ice. Strain and pour into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Union League Cocktail
directions: Combine gin, ruby port and orange bitters in a shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Undertow
ingredients: guava syrup or passion fruit syrup
directions: Combine all ingredients but the lime. Peel in a blender with one cup ice. Blend for 15 to 20 minutes until smooth and pour into a chilled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with the lime peel.

name: Union Jack Cocktail
ingredients: Creme Yvette or crème de violette
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Under the Volcano Martini
directions: Combine mezcal and martini & ross vermouth in a cocktail glass filled with ice and stir. Garnish with the jalapeño and stuffed olive.

name: Unchained
directions: Combine CAMUS VS Elegance Cognac and raspberry liqueur in a Champagne flûte. Top with Champagne and garnish with raspberry.

name: Ultimate Indulgence
directions: Shake well and serve in a highball glass. Shave chocolate as a garnish.

name: Ultimate Bell Pepper Cocktail
ingredients: lemon juice (or orange juice if you want to accent sweet more)
Galliano liqueur (feel free to sub another herbal liqueur like Chartreuse)
directions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the mint and bell pepper with the juices. Add ice, vodka and liqueur. Shake vigorously. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with bell pepper ring.

name: Ulanda
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake, and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Ugly
directions: Combine in a beer mug.

name: U-Z
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, swirl, and strain into a shot glass.

name: Twisted Nutty Rum
ingredients: Flor de Caña 7 Year Grand Reserve rum
directions: Shake with ice, strain into rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Tuxedo
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker over ice. Mix well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Turkey in a Bowl
directions: Place a block of ice in the punch bowl and add whiskey. Really, that’s it. Serve in a rocks glass with ice.

Provide mixers, such as cola, ginger ale, and soda water, for guests to customize their drinks. For a bit of festivity, provide Thanksgiving-seasonal garnishes, such as cranberries, rosemary, sage, and cinnamon sticks.

name: Turbo
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, mix and strain into a shot glass or an old fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Tucson Martini
directions: Shake vodka, triple sec, prickly pear syrup with ice. Pour into martini glass with jalapeño-stuffed olive.

name: True Blood
directions: Add all the ingredients (except Ginger Beer) into a mixing glass. Add ice and shake for ten seconds. Strain into a highball glass. Top with ginger beer.

name: Tropical Itch
directions: Combine in a shaker with a cup of ice. Pour, with ice into a double old fashion or collins glass. Top with additional passion fruit juice if needed.

name: Triple Crown Julep
ingredients: 10 Kentucky Colonel Mint or Spearmint Leaves
directions: 1. Muddle brown sugar and water in pint glass until sugar dissolves.
2. Add chopped strawberries, lemon wedges and mint leaves and muddle well.
3. Add Basil Hayden’s and shake.
4. Add ice and shake once again.
5. Strain cocktail over crushed ice and garnish with a mint sprig and strawberry.

name: Trick or Treat “Shotail”
ingredients: (15 ml) Luxardo Passione Nera black sambuca
directions: Pour the chilled ingredients carefully into a shot glass so that the green and black layers keep separate. First add the sambuca, and then the Midori. Try pouring the Midori over the back of a teaspoon to follow the trick of professional bartenders.

name: Trick-or-Tini
directions: Chill ingredients in fridge or freezer. Once cooled, pour the first three ingredients, in the order listed above, slowly over the back side of a spoon into a martini glass. Top with a splash of white rum.

name: Trick or Treat
directions: Garnish with sour or regular gummi worms. Place necessary amount of silly straws.

name: Traditional Mexican Ponche (Punch)
ingredients: 2 golden delicious apples, peeled, cored, and cut in eighths
3 (3 to 4-inch) pieces sugarcane, each cut in strips
½ pound crabapples, peeled and cored
directions: In a large pot, place the fruit, sugar, cinnamon, and 8 cups of water. Bring to a boil and lower heat and simmer for 1 hour. Serve hot in a glass mug that has a shot of tequila in it. Serves 8.

name: Touchdown
directions: Combine bourbon and iced tea in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a hurricane glass filled with ice. Top with the lemonade.

name: Top Banana
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Too Full Flor Dessert
directions: Pour all ingredients in a mixing glass. Shake for 20 seconds. Serve over chilled martini glass.

name: Tom Collins
directions: Fill a collins glass with ice. You can build this one right in the glass. Garnish with a cherry and a lemon slice.

name: Tootsie Roll
directions: Pour in mixing glass, shake well and strain into shot glass.

name: Tongue Tied
directions: Shake X-Rated and Skyy Infusions Cherry over ice. Strain into a martini glass. Slowly add a dash of grenadine so that it sinks to the bottom. Garnish with a cherry with a knotted stem.

name: Tom & Jerry
directions: Separate the egg whites from the yolks. In a large bowl, beat the egg whites until they stiffen. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks and then beat in the allspice, sugar, cinnamon, and cloves. Fold the yolk into the whites. This is the batter. For each drink, pour 2 tablespoons of this batter and then add one ounce of Cognac and one ounce of dark rum. Top off with the hot milk. Stir ingredients together and top each drink with a dusting of cinnamon or nutmeg.

name: Tokyo Iced Tea
directions: Build in a collins glass filled with ice, adding each ingredient one by one. Stir well.

name: Toasted Coconut Colada
ingredients: Coco Lopez or sweetened coconut milk
directions: Combine all ingredients plus 9 large ice cubes in blender and process until smooth. Serve in hurricane glass. Top with toasted coconut, pineapple wedge. Add large straw and an orchid.
*Homemade sour mix
Ingredients:
1 part fresh lemon juice
1 part fresh lime juice
2 parts simple syrup
¼ part fresh orange juice

name: Toast Oprah Farewell with Tequila Cocktails
Toasted Almond
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Tiki’s Revenge
directions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add Voodoo Tiki Desert Rose, melon liqueur, sour, and mango juice. Shake well and pour into a chilled highball glass.

name: Tidy Bowl
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice. Mix and strain into a shot glass.

name: The Victory Cocktail
directions: Combine each set of ingredients in advance as you’ll want to blend these quickly one after another.
Blend the ingredients of layer 3 and place in the base of the glass.
Blend the ingredients of layer 2 and layer carefully over the first base.
Blend the ingredients of layer 1 and layer carefully.
Garnish with half a strawberry and 3 blueberries.

name: Three Rivers
directions: Fill mixing glass with ice. Add whiskey, Dubonnet and triple sec. Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with ice.

name: Three Amigos
directions: Pour separately into tall shot glasses. This is a variation of a drink that has long been enjoyed in Jalisco, the Mexican State where tequila is made. One first takes a sip of the Tequila, then chases it with a sip of sangrita and lime juice. Take it slow & enjoy.

name: The Ultimate Cuba Libre
directions: Half fill a chilled highball or collins glass with ice cubes, add rum and fill with cold cola. Stir gently and squeeze the lime wedge over drink and drop into glass.

name: The Whiskey Sour 101
directions: Froth egg white in a shaker with out ice (they call this a dry shake), shake hard for 15–20 seconds. Add ice, Wild Turkey, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and honey. Shake and strain into an old fashioned glass over fresh ice. Garnish with Wild Turkey American Honey-soaked cherry.*
*American Honey Soaked Cherries
1 ounce Wild Turkey American Honey
2–3 fresh cherries
Slice cherry from top to bottom five times around pit, and soak in a cup of Wild Turkey American Honey.

name: The Thin Man Dry Martini
directions: Pour into a cocktail shaker, shake and strain into a chilled martini glass.

name: The TeaQuila-rita
ingredients: Sprigs of fresh mint + lemon wedges for garnish
directions: In a medium saucepan bring water, tea bags and sugar to a rolling boil. Stir until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and let sit for 15 minutes. Remove tea bags and pour into a glass pitcher. Cool sweet tea in refrigerator several hours. When the tea is cool, add the Tequila. Pour over ice and garnish with a lemon wedge and a sprig of mint.

name: The Starlet
directions: In a cocktail shaker combine simple syrup, lime juice, and mint leaves. Use a muddler or a wooden spoon to muddle the mint leaves. Add tequila and elderflower liqueur and fill shaker with ice. Shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Strain into a glass and top with Moët & Chandon. Garnish with starfruit.

name: The Smitten Shine
directions: In a mixing glass, muddle 5 raspberries add all other ingredients. Dry shake to emulsify egg white. Add ice and shake vigorously. Double strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with 3 raspberries and chocolate shavings.

name: The Stir Tropical Sparkler
ingredients: 4 fresh pineapple chunks from the syrup 3
directions: Put three of the pineapple chunks in the bottom of a champagne flute and set aside. At the bottom of a shaker, muddle the remaining pineapple with the rum, syrup, and bitters. Shake with ice and then strain into the champagne flute. Top with the sparkling wine.
*DIY rich pineapple syrup (makes about 2 cups)
2 cups sugar
1 cup water
½ fresh pineapple, cored and sliced into 1 ½-inch chunks

Bring the sugar and water to a boil. Let simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Place the pineapple chunks in a large bowl and pour the cooled syrup over them. Cover and let it steep and chill overnight in the refrigerator. Do not discard the pineapples; store them in the syrup so you can use them in the cocktail.

name: The Steeler
directions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice, then strain into cocktail glass.

name: The Steel Curtain
directions: Mix in a large glass with ice. Garnish with a lime. Serve and enjoy.

name: The Shamrocker
directions: Combine ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a shot glass. Garnish with an orange slice.

name: The Shamrock-tini
tags: baileys with a hint of milk chocolate
ingredients: Baileys with a Hint of Milk Chocolate
directions: Add Baileys with a hint of Mint Chocolate and vodka to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: The Rockin’ Paloma
directions: Add Cabo, lime juice, and cucumber to pint glass, muddle, add ice and shake vigorously. Add soda to shaker and stir. Strain over fresh ice into a collins glass with a salted rim. Drop the grenadine on top and allow it to mix in. Garnish with cucumber slice, serve and enjoy!

name: The Seersucker
directions: Muddle, shake with 3 ice cubes & strain into a pilsner glass with crushed ice. Garnish with a fresh strawberry.
*Make the cinnamon bark syrup by boiling three cinnamon sticks with one cup of water and one cup of sugar for 15 minutes, then strain. Refrigerate unused portion.

name: The Rosé Sparkler
directions: Shake first two ingredients and strain into chilled Champagne flute. Top with Champagne. Garnish with blueberries and a cherry dropped in.

name: The Rooster
ingredients: cinnamon schnapps laced with gold flakes
directions: Pour, mix, and enjoy!

name: The Red Witch
directions: Stir and serve in champagne flute. Garnish with a cherry.

name: The Real Wedding Crasher
tags: Movie and TV MILFs and their Cocktails
ingredients: Splash of orange liqueur or triple sec
directions: Shake ingredients over ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Add squeeze of fresh lime wedge, garnish with a lime twist and serve.

name: The Prickly Margarita
directions: Place all ingredients, except amaretto in a shaker, muddle jalapeño, add ice, and shake vigorously. Strain over fresh ice into a rocks glass, float amaretto on top, garnish with a lime wheel, and serve!

name: The Peaches and Scream
directions: Muddle and strain the Bourbon, Cream, Peach Purée and Apple Butter Syrup into a martini glass with a brown sugar rim. Garnish with your choice of a peach or apple slice.

name: THE PB&J
directions: Shake all ingredients in a Boston shaker without ice, then add ice and shake vigorously again.  Strain into a chilled cocktail glass that is rimmed with minced salted-peanuts.  Garnish:  A banana slice.
2 parts water
2 parts sugar
1 part minced peanuts
Combine 2 parts water with 2 parts sugar in a pot.  Bring sugar water to a boil. Add 1 part minced peanuts. Simmer for 10 minutes. Strain to remove peanut particles.

name: The Orange Turf
directions: Serve over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with lime and orange.

name: The One-Cheek Sneek
ingredients: amaretto bitters or Disaronno Drinker's Choice
directions: Pour schnapps and vodka first, then pour in Kahlúa, amaretto, and tequila while stirring, top off with whipped cream or fill with non-alcoholic beverage of your choice (preferably cranberry or fruit punch).

name: The Olympic
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with the orange peel.

name: The Old-Fashioned Cheesehead
ingredients: Agave nectar to taste (desired level of sweetness)
directions: Add nectar and bitters to an old-fashioned glass and stir. Add ice and Hornitos Tequila then stir well. Top off glass with ice and garnish with a chunk of sharp Wisconsin cheddar cheese.

name: The One-Cheek Sneak
directions: Pour schnapps and vodka first, then pour in Kahlúa, amaretto, and tequila while stirring. Top off with whipped cream or fill with non-alcoholic beverage of your choice (preferably cranberry or fruit punch).

name: The Old Fashioned 101
directions: Directions:
Slice cherry from top to bottom five times around pit, and soak in Amaretto.
Muddle cider, sage, saffron, brown sugar, orange twists and zest together in glass. Add Wild Turkey Bourbon and stir. Strain and serve over ice, garnish with your Amaretto-soaked cherry.

name: The Obituary Cocktail
directions: Combine with cracked ice in a cocktail shaker. Stir then strain into a chilled cocktail glass; no garnish.

name: The Nominees Are…
directions: Mix in a glass with ice and garnish with an orange slice.

name: The New North Beach
directions: Shake and double strain into coupe glass.
Garnish with orange zest

name: The Marpessa
directions: Combine with ice in a cocktail shaker, Shake and strain into a chilled, tall cocktail glass, garnished with a thinly sliced lime wheel.

name: The New French Revolution
directions: Add all ingredients to a champagne flute, top with Brut Champagne.

name: The Mockingjay
directions: Shake hard, strain over rocks. Garnish with a cherry and a few orange slices.
Courtesy of Frangelico.

name: The Maker’s Heart
directions: In a mixing glass combine blackberries, pomegranate juice and lemon juice. Muddle. Add ice and remaining ingredients. Shake and strain over fresh ice. Garnish with an orange peel. Rim with navel orange-zested sugar.*
*For sugar rim, take one oz of plain white sugar and zest it with four peels of orange.

name: The Lusty Maritime Punch
directions: Combine all liquids in a punch bowl and stir. Add lemon wheels and fruit (depending the season you could use vagarious berries, peaches, apples, pears). Serve over ice in a punch cup. Serves 8–10. (Tip: chill all ingredients prior to making your punch!)

name: The Last “F” You
directions: Mix in a shaker with ice, strain into a highball. I recommend filling the glass with ice before adding the booze.

name: The Kilauea – Pau Hana Friday Cocktail
The Jolly Red Giants
directions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a martini glass over a brandied cherry, or over ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: The Jeweler
directions: In a shot glass, first pour the silver tequila. Next, gently—over a spoon is ideal!—add the gold.

name: The Leprechaun’s Pot of Gold (Irisih Absinthetini)
directions: Pour over ice, stir gently, rim your glass with your twist of lemon then float it. Let this sit for a minute, sip and enjoy.

name: The Happy Mom
directions: Shake first four ingredients with ice in a shaker; strain into chilled martini glass, garnish with cherry.

name: The Green Crush
directions: Shake with Ice. Serve in highball glass filled with crushed ice. Top with orange soda. Garnish with an orange wedge.

name: The Green Ocelot
ingredients:
2oz Scorpion Silver Mezcal
3/4oz Cayenne Pepper infused, Matcha Green Tea Syrup
3/4oz Fresh Lemon Juice
Garnish: 50/50 Match powder/salt rim
and a lime spiral twist
directions: Rim rocks glass with Matcha/salt. Then combine all ingredients in a small metal shaker cup with 4 ice cubes. Shake generously. Strain over new ice. Add lime spiral, then enjoy…

name: The Green Lantern
ingredients: 2–3 muddled limes and long green lime spiral
directions: In a rocks glass, muddle 3 lime wedges, add ice, melon liqueur and absinthe and transfer to a shaker. Shake thoroughly and return into rocks glass. Now add the ginger ale and the lime spiral.

name: The Great Pumpkin
ingredients: Baileys with a Hint of Caramel
directions: Combine Ketel One and Baileys with a hint of caramel in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well vigorously until chilled. Add the pumpkin liqueur and shake again. Strain into a rocks glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: The Dublin Apple
directions: Shake the ingredients well over ice in a cocktail shaker, strain, and serve in a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a slice of apple.

name: The DramBOOie
directions: Shake with ice and strained into martini glass garnished with cinnamon stick and whipped cream.

name: The Dean’s Wife
directions: Serve in a highball glass.

name: The Crimson Tide
directions: Build in a collins glass filled with ice. Add rums and grenadine. Fill the rest of the way with cranberry juice.

name: The Cupid Shine
directions: Stir all ingredients. Strain into old fashioned glass with one large cube of ice. Garnish with either chocolate covered strawberry or strawberry half and shaved chocolate.

name: The Creepy Colada
directions: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake gently and strain into a chilled martini glass with a sphere of ice. Garnish with fresh mint leaves.

name: The Concorde
directions: In a mixing tin, muddle six thin slices of cucumber. Add Jett and ice. Shake well and strain into an ice filled highball glass. Top off with soda water and garnish with a slice of cucumber.

name: The Bubbly Apricot
directions: Pour apricot and triple sec purée into a champagne flute and carefully top off with chilled champagne.
*Apricot and triple sec purée
Ingredients:
¼ cup triple sec
2 fresh apricots
Directions:
Chop apricots and place blender along with the triple sec; puree. Makes enough for 2 cocktails. (Optional: put ingredients together and store in freezer for an hour or more, before pureeing)

name: The Clockwork Oranje
directions: Add all ingredients to a collins glass. Fill the glass with crushed ice. Use a swizzle stick to stir and blend ingredients. Garnish with an orange wedge.

name: The Celtic Buck
ingredients: 3 slices pear and 1 stick cinnamon (for garnish)
directions: In cocktail shaker, combine Scotch, pear nectar, lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon allspice syrup. Fill with ice and shake 20 seconds. Strain drink into tall glass filled with fresh ice. Top with ginger ale.
For allspice syrup:
1 teaspoon ground allspice
2 cups sugar
2 cups water
Make allspice syrup:

In medium saucepan over moderately high heat, combine 2 cups water and sugar, stirring until sugar dissolves. Bring to boil, then stir in allspice. Remove from heat and let stand 45 minutes. Strain through fine-mesh sieve. (Syrup can be made ahead and refrigerated, tightly covered, up to 3 weeks.)

name: The Bookworm
directions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle the strawberries with the brandy, grapefruit juice and sugar. Add ice and tequila and shake vigorously. Strain into collins glass filled with ice and top off with club soda. Garnish with grapefruit slices or strawberries.

name: The Boothby
directions: Add ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Top with Moët and garnish with a Luxardo maraschino cherry (trust us these are the real deal).

name: The Bloody Halfback
directions: Combine ingredients in a tall glass and garnish with a lime wedge.

name: The Blazin’ Shooter
directions: Cover the bottom of a shot glass with Tabasco sauce and fill the rest with tequila. Finish with a lime wedge.

name: The Bee’s Teas Gin Cocktail
ingredients: Beefeater 24 Gin (actually a wee bit more than this)
directions: Steep the tea bag in the gin for about 10-15 minutes (I overpoured a little bit, since some liquid will get lost in the process). The resulting liquid should be the color of a dark cup of tea. Mix the honey into the warm water so it dissolves. Pour the gin tea, honey-water and lemon juice over ice in a cocktail shaker and shake very gently. Pour into a rocks glass and add frozen cranberries.
Optional: top off with splash of club soda.

name: The Awapuhi – Pau Hana Friday Cocktail
The Autumn Aperitif
directions: Pour Ketel One Oranje, sweet vermouth, Zwack and agostura bitters in a rocks glass over ice. Gently stir.
Garnish with a an orange peel.

name: The 56 Julep
ingredients: 3 sprigs of mint (six to eight mature-sized leaves)
directions: In a traditional silver julep cup or double-old fashioned glass, muddle two sprigs of mint with the brown sugar and one ounce of Wild Turkey 101 for a few minutes, crushing the mint leaves with a spoon. Add the crushed ice, the remaining bourbon, and garnish with sprig of mint.

name: The 1820
tags: Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel Aged Bitters
ingredients: 1 bar spoon Del Maguey Minero Mezcal
Fee Brothers Whiskey Barrel Aged Bitters
directions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Thanksgiving Toast
directions: Shake vigorously with ice and strain into martini glass. Add a float of ginger ale after straining. Garnish with 3 roasted walnut halves, speared cranberries, or a sprig of rosemary.

name: Thanksgiving 101
ingredients:
Wild Turkey 101 on the rocks
Cranberries
Rosemary
directions: Serve in a rocks glass. Garnish with cranberries and a sprig of rosemary.

name: Thai Basil Cucumber Margarita
directions: Combine Thai basil and two slices of cucumber in a shaker and muddle with the agave nectar or simple syrup. Add the fresh lime juice and Peligroso tequila with crystal clear ice. Shake vigorously and pour over the ice rocks. Top off with a splash of ginger ale. Garnish with a cucumber slice on the side with a sprig of basil. Throw just a small pinch of black pepper ontop.

name: Thai Spring Mojito
ingredients: of white rum (or vodka if you prefer)
1 pinch fresh ginger, peeled and grated
directions: In the bottom of a collins or mixing glass, muddle the sugar, water, herbs and lime juice. Pour in rum and stir. Top with crushed ice and club soda. Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Thai Basil Martini
directions: Mix ingredients in a cocktail shaker, add ice, and shake. Garnish with a fresh basil leaf.
To infuse gin, pour 8 ounces in a jar and add 8–10 fresh, washed Thai basil leaves. Cover tightly and let sit for about a week.

name: Tequila Sunset
directions: Place Cabo Wabo, lemon juice, and agave nectar in a shaker with ice, shake vigorously and strain over fresh ice into a Collins glass. Stir in soda water, and top with framboise and pomegranate. Mix into drink and serve with a lemon twist.

name: Texan Hot Chocolate
directions: Combine Paula’s Texas Orange, chocolate chips, sugar and milk in a pot and bring to a slow boil over low-medium heat as to not burn the Milk. Remove from heat and add Tito’s Handmade Vodka. Pour into favorite coffee/cocoa/tea mug and top with marshmallows. Garnish with an orange twist and shaved or grated chocolate.

name: Tequila Sunrise
directions: Place 3–4 ice cubes in a collins or highball glass. Pour in tequila, then orange juice, and finally the grenadine. Do not stir, let the grenadine settle to the bottom of the glass. This will create the “sunrise” effect. Garnish with an orange slice.

name: Tequila Ghost
directions: Combine tequila, anise, and lemon juice in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass over ice. Top with a splash of club soda.

name: Tennessee
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake, and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Tequila Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Tea-quila Toddy
ingredients:
1 hibiscus tea bag
Agave nectar to taste
Cinnamon stick
Fresh cilantro or basil
3–6 cloves
Cabo Wabo tequila blanco
oz
water
oz
directions: Heat water in a sauce pan or tea kettle until hot, but be careful not to boil. Remove from heat, add one tea bag and three cloves, and steep for 2–3 minutes. In a large glass tea cup, combine Cabo Wabo Tequila with a cinnamon stick, one clove, cilantro and orange slice. Remove tea bag from the hot tea, and pour into mug.

name: Tea for Toronto
directions: Blend all the ingredients (with the exception of the tea bag) in a teapot. Place in the fridge for two hours.
Add a dry ice cube into the teapot then pour into a teacup containing the tea bag.
Macerate to your taste and remove the bag.

name: Taxi
ingredients: Stoli Oranj vodka or Absolut Tangerine vodka
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a shot glass or an old fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Tangerine Rose
directions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice, shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a pink rose petal.

*To make rose syrup, boil water and remove from heat.  Add one heaping tablespoon of dried rose petals for each quart of water boiled and let steep for five minutes.  Strain rose petals from the water and mix with equal parts of sugar until dissolved

name: Tamarindo Margarita
directions: Rim glass with coarse salt and chili powder
Lime wheel and tamarindo peel for garnish

name: Tall Tale
directions: Muddle cucumber and blackberries in a mixing glass. Add tequila, lemon juice, agave nectar and ice. Shake and strain into a tall glass with ice. Top with ginger beer and stir. Garnish with cucumber wheel.

name: Take Me Out To The Moneyball-game
Taboo
directions: Combine vodka, triple sec, cranberry juice and sour mix in a blender with one cup ice, blend 15–20 seconds until smooth and serve in a collins or highball glass. Garnish with pineapple wedge and maraschino cherry.

name: Take Me Out to the Ballgame
Tailgate Toddy
directions: Measure all ingredients into a heat proof mug or glass. Place teaspoon in glass; add boiling water to fill glass (teaspoon prevents glass from breaking when boiling water is added). Stir mixture and serve immediately.

name: Swing State Spritzer
ingredients:
Skinnygirl Bare Naked Vodka
parts
5 muddled blueberries
Dash of grenadine
Club soda
directions: Mix all ingredients except club soda
Pour over ice, top with a splash of club and enjoy

name: Sweet Dreams
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a caramel rim.

name: Sweet and Spooky Creamsicle
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled martini glass. Serve with candy corn and rock candy swizzle stick.

name: Sweet & Salty
ingredients: white Bacardi rum (or your favorite rum)
directions: Fill a pint glass to the top with ice. Cut lemon in half and squeeze half of the lemon into the glass coating the ice. Pour your shot in and then fill the glass ? with Squirt. Pour in a little Coke—just enough to change the color of the drink to light brown. Put salt on the other half of the lemon and salt the rim, then squeeze the lemon into the drink. Add a couple shakes of salt directly into the drink, stir a little, and enjoy!

name: Swamp Thing
directions: Combine all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.

name: Swedish Sun Cocktail
directions: Muddle rhubarb and strawberries. Add remaining ingredients and ice to a shaker and shake hard until lice cold. Double-strain, garnish with strawberry and rhubarb.

name: Swedish Kiss
directions: Add ingredients (except for foam) to a mixing glass and stir until ice cold. Dispense one inch of foam* into bottom of a chilled coupe and then strain liquid on top. Top with white froth, garnish with a strawberry.
* editors note. not 100% sure how to do the foam? Let us know in the comments if you do.

name: Swamp Thing
ingredients:
½ a blood orange (sliced with peel and pith removed)
Sprig of mint leaves
2 lime slices
Powdered sugar
black vodka
oz
Ice
directions: Put the blood orange slices and mint leaves in a glass and muddle them. Add a squirt of lime and a small sprinkling of powdered sugar. Put ice and black vodka in a cocktail shaker to cool, pour over the mixture and stir gently. Garnish with a lime slice.

name: Super Bowl XLIV Cocktail: Who Dat Highball
directions: Fill highball glass with ice. Pour in cognac and syrup. Top off with club soda and garnish with a lemon wheel.
*Apple-lemon syrup:
(enough for 10 cocktails)
1 ½ cups water
1 apple–cored, peeled and cut into pieces
zest of half a lemon (just the peel, no white pith)
1 cup sugar
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and boil. Strain out solids and pour the syrup into a container. Cool syrup and refrigerate. To make syrup last longer, add a 1/2 oz of vodka.

name: Super Bowl XLIV Cocktail: The Blue Stampede
directions: Pour into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into rocks glass. You can make a bigger batch by multiplying all ingredients by 8 and combining in a punch bowl.

name: Super Bowl Buster
directions: Add all ingredients except soda to a mixing glass, and shake vigorously, and then add ice and shake again. Strain shaker into a highball and top with Club soda. Garnish with an orange zest (optional).

name: Sunset Twist
directions: Build over ice in a rocks glass. Top with orange juice and garnish with an orange twist.

name: Summer Solstice Smash
directions: Muddle the nectarine, lemon, and tangerine at the bottom of your shaker. Add ice, liqueur, simple syrup, cognac and mint (slap the mint first), then shake. Pour into an old-fashioned glass filled with crushed ice.

name: Summer Solstice
directions: Combine American Honey, grapefruit juice and bitters in a tumbler with ice and stir. Strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

name: Summer Slush
directions: Boil tea bags with two cups of the water. Set aside and let cool. Boil the remaining 7 cups of water with 2 cups of sugar. Bring to boil and remove from heat. Set aside and let cool to room temperature. Once sugar mixture is cool add the orange juice and the lemonade. Add water from the tea and squeeze tea bags. Add vodka or gin. Stir together and freeze over night. Serve in a highball and top with about 2 oz of 7 Up. Makes 40–50 drinks.

name: Summer of Picasso
ingredients:
2oz Scorpion Silver Mezcal
.75oz Ginger Infused Sour Mix
.5oz Celery Purée
1.25oz Strawberry purée
Garnish:
Celery Stick and Oversized lemon twist
directions: Combine all ingredients into a small shaker cup, add 5 ice cubes and generously shake. Strain into martini glass and add celery stick and lemon twist garnishes. Sip and enjoy

name: Summer Gin Punch
directions: Build all ingredients in a mixing glass over ice, then transfer contents into a punch cup.

name: Sultry Samantha
directions: Shake with ice and strain over fresh ice in a highball or cocktail glass. Garnish with an apple slice or cinnamon stick.
*Simple syrup: 1 part water & 2 parts organic cane sugar brought to a boil in a sauce pan and cooled.

name: Strawberry Lemon Drop
ingredients: Splash of grenadine or cherry juice
directions: Combine in shaker over ice. Mix well and serve in a chilled cocktail glass (rimmed with sugar) or as a shot!

name: Sugar & Spice Martini
ingredients: Splash of brown sugar simple syrup
directions: Shake with ice. Serve in a martini (cocktail) glass that has been rimmed with a mixture of cinnamon and superfine sugar.

name: Strawberry Tarragon Cocktail
directions: Muddle the berries, tarragon, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker. Add gin and lemon juice. Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a strawberry, if desired.
*You can use any gin you like, but I personally think that in this case the botanical profile of Hendrick’s played a big part in the balance of the drink.

** The amount of simple syrup in this recipe is based on the fresh-from-the-garden berries I had available to me. Store berries are often less sweet, so you may have to add another berry or another splash of syrup to taste.

name: Strawberry Kir
ingredients: Hiram Walker crème de strawberry liqueur
directions: Serve in a champagne flute and garnish with a fresh strawberry.

name: Strawberry Ginger Martini
directions: Crush/muddle strawberries in a shaker. Add ice, lime, gin and Domaine de Canton. Shake well and serve in chilled martini glass.

name: Strawberry Ginger Martini
directions: Muddle the strawberries in a Boston Shaker with the juice of one lemon or lime wedge. Add 5–6 ice cubes, the vodka (or gin if that is you inclination) and ginger liqueur. Shake well and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a slice of strawberry.

name: Strawberry Cheesecake
directions: Mix all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well to chill. Strain in to a large shot glass.

name: Strawberry Basil Mojito
directions: Slice the strawberries and place at the bottom of a tall glass along with the basil leaves. Pour in the simple syrup and muddle the mixture. Stir in the rum and top with crushed ice. Top off with club soda and garnish with strawberry slices.

name: Steelers Squeeze
directions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint.

name: Steelers Cider
directions: Combine Maker’s Mark bourbon and apple cider in a pot. Add the thinly sliced lemon (with rind), cloves, allspice, and cinnamon sticks. Heat to boiling and serve. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Stoop Party
directions: Build over ice in highball glass. Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Stinger
directions: Combine ingredients in shaker with 1 cup of crushed ice. Shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Stars and Stripes
directions: Stars
Muddle blueberries and lime juice in a glass. Add tequila and agave nectar. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into shot glass.
Stripes
Shake and serve in shot glass half rimmed with a salt, pepper and cayenne mixture.

name: Star Spangled Punch
ingredients:
The peel of 3 lemons, each cut in a ½ inch/15 mm wide spiral with a vegetable peeler
¾ cup/180 ml sugar
¾ cup/180 ml fresh-squeezed, strained lemon juice
1 750-ml bottle Chilean Pisco
1 quart/1 liter cold water
1 star fruit
directions: Muddle the lemon peels and the sugar together and let sit for at least 90 minutes. Muddle lemon and sugar again and stir in the lemon juice. Add the pisco and the water and stir. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve. Before serving, cut star fruit into ¼ to ½ inch slices. To serve, pour into a 1 gallon/4-liter Punch bowl with a 1-quart/1-liter sized block of ice in it and float star fruit slices. Serves 12 people.

name: St. Patrick’s Day Irish Whiskey Cocktails
St. Francis Cocktail
ingredients:
Junipero gin
Dry vermouth
Orange bitters
directions: Stir 2–3 oz of gin with a dash each of vermouth and orange bitters in a mixing glass over ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with mixed olives.

name: Spring Shiso
ingredients:
Bombay Sapphire Gin
oz
3 Shiso Leaves
1 inch cut English Seedless Cucumber
1/2oz Fresh Lemon Juice
1/2oz Simple Syrup
Glass: Collins
Garnish: Thin cucumber Strip lined in glass and Shiso leaf atop
directions: Line glass with cucumber strip. Then muddle Cucumber and Shiso in a pint glass. Then combine all other ingredients, add 5 ice cubes and shake well. Strain all ingredients over new ice. Finally add Shiso Leaf.

name: Spring Fling
directions: In a large pitcher combine the sugar, mint lemons and cucumber. Add the vodka and lemon juice and let stand for 30 min. Stir to dissolve the sugar, then chill for another 30 min. When ready to serve add the club soda and serve in rocks glasses filled with ice.

name: Spring Melon
directions: In a shaker, combine ice, vodka and lime juice. Stir gently and strain into a chilled rocks glass. Top with VOGA Sparkling and garnish with lemon or lime slice.

name: Spirted Punch
directions: Place sugar in punch bowl. Add orange peel and muddle to release oils. Add tea while still hot to dilute sugar. Add remaining ingredients, stir & finish with large cubes of ice.

name: Spin, Spin Sugar
directions: Mix the Vodka, White Crème de Cacao and Green Crème de Menthe. All ingredients are shaken over ice and strained into a chilled martini glass rimmed with chocolate shavings.

name: Spider’s Kiss
directions: Draw a chocolate web into a cocktail glass. Place in freezer and chill. Shake Midori, vodka, and lemon juice and strain into glass. For a blood effect, drizzle grenadine down the side of the glass. Garnish with a chocolate-dipped orange slice.

name: Spiced Spiked Cider
directions: Combine in pan bring to boil and serve in a footed mug with cinnamon stick and a garnish of lemon peel.

name: Spicy Sangre Orange Margarita
directions: Muddle 2 slices of Jalapeño or Serrano chile with 2 oz. of Peligroso Silver Tequila in a shaker.
Add ice and 4 oz. of blood orange juice (or other juices, such as tangerine or mango), 1 oz. Cointreau or Triple Sec and a 1/2 squeezed fresh lime. Shake well and serve on the rocks in a tumbler.

name: Spiced Tea Holiday Punch
directions: Boil water, honey, sugar, spices and vanilla in a large saucepan, stirring frequently until honey and sugar are dissolved. Remove from heat and add tea bag, steeping for five minutes. Strain it into a bowl and add wine and rum. Can be served hot or cold. If serving it hot, simmer mixture until warm again. If serving cold, chill mixture in refrigerator then serve over ice. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Spiced Sangria
ingredients:
1.5oz Remy VSOP
3oz White Zinfandel
.5oz Spiced Simple Syrup
1oz White Cranberry Juice
directions: Mix all ingredients together with 2 orange slices squeezed and put in glass. Add a dash of cinnamon and all spice cherries for garnish.

name: Spiced Pumpkin
directions: Shake with ice, strain into a cinnamon sugar rimmed martini glass, and garnish with a cherry.

name: Spice Night
directions: Place all ingredients in cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with whole allspice pods (they will float atop cocktail).
* Scented apple juice
Overnight, combine 3-4 whole allspice pods with one cracked cinnamon stick to 2 cups of apple juice. Refrigerate.
**Ginger juice
If fresh ginger juice is not available it can be ordered at gingerpeople.com.

name: Spiced Pear Toddy
ingredients: Perfect Purée Green Apple Puree, thawed
directions: Build all ingredients into mug and stir. Garnish with cinnamon stick and pear wedge. Serve in a tea cup
Baking Spice Syrup:
1 cup water
1 tsp. ground cinnamon
1 tsp. unsweetened cocoa powder
½ tsp. ground cloves
½ tsp. ground all spice
1 whole star anise

In a pot, bring water to boil. Add all spices. Lower temperature and simmer for 3-5 minutes. Remove from stove and pour mixture through strainer into a measuring cup.  Add water to return volume of mixture to 1 cup and return to pot. Add sugar and stir to dissolve. Pour mixture into storage container. Seal and refrigerate. Will keep refrigerated for 3-4 weeks.

name: Spice and Everything Nice Mulled Cider
directions: Combine Maker’s Mark and apple cider. Add lemon, cloves, ground allspice, and cinnamon sticks. Heat to boiling and serve.

name: Sparkling Pineapple
ingredients: Top with pineapple juice and fresh pineapple
directions: In a shaker, mix vodka and lime juice.  Pour in glass and top with VOGA Sparkling, pineapple juice and fresh pineapple.

name: Sparkling Spring Punch
directions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl. Fill a bundt pan or large metal bowl with water and fruit slices, then freeze. Use warm water to loosen it, then put the large ice block in your punch bowl. The larger ice will melt more slowly while still keeping your punch cold. Alternatively, you could put ice in the individual serving cups. Optional: Add several dashes of angostura bitters.

name: Sparkling Rye Cocktail
directions: Pour the rye, grapefruit juice and simple syrup into a chilled champagne flute. Then pour in chilled sparkling wine.

name: Sparkling Peppermint Swirl
directions: In a shaker, combine ice, vodka and crème de menthe and grenadine. Stir gently and strain into a chilled martini glass rimmed with crushed candy canes. Top with VOGA Sparkling and garnish with a candy cane.

name: Sparkling Hibiscus Champagne Cocktail
directions: Position the hibiscus flower at the bottom of a champagne flute and slowly fill it with your favorite bubbly. As the champagne fizzles, the hibiscus flower will open up and bloom in your glass. Once you drink your bubbly, refill it. Or, just nibble on the edible flower.

name: Sparkling Candy Apple
directions: Shake the rum, the juice and the syrup with cracked ice. Strain into a chilled white wine glass and fill with VOGA Italia Sparkling Wine.

name: Sparkling Black Cherry Cooler
directions: Combine ingredients except for seltzer in a tall glass and stir very well
Pour over ice and top with seltzer – then stir again

name: Spanish Coffee
directions: Serve in a large espresso glass or footed mug.

name: Sorrento in Red
directions: Pour ingredients over ice into a shaker. Shake and strain ingredients over ice into stemmed wine glass. No garnish.

name: Soul Martini
directions: Soul Straight Up: Combine the Vodka and Creme de Cacao in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a martini glass.

Soul on the Rocks: Combine the vodka and crème de cacao in a shaker, stir and pour into a rocks glass coated filled with ice (coat the rim of the rocks glass in chocolate). To coat the rim of martini glass or rocks glass with Chocolate, dip the rim in powdered chocolate.

name: Snowball
directions: In a mixer with ice, shake ingredients well. Serve in a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Sour Witch
directions: In the bottom of a mixing glass, muddle the sour cherries in the lime juice and almond syrup.  Add the Lucid with ice and shake very well. Strain into a chilled champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine or champagne. Garnish: freshly-grated nutmeg.

name: Smoky Martini
directions: Combine is a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a blue cheese stuffed olive and a pepperoni.

name: Smoke & Spice
directions: Combine all ingredients into a Boston style shaker, add ice, shake, then strain into a martini glass.
Finally garnish with a cucumber stick.

name: Smashing Pumpkin Martini
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Stir gently and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. A good substitute for the infused vodka is ½ oz of Stoli cinnamon vodka & ½ oz of Bols Pumpkin Smash liqueur.

name: Smitten Pears
directions: Muddle the plum and ginger together. Add pear vodka, honey syrup, a squeeze of lemon and ice. Shake and strain into martini glass.

name: Smashed Pumpkin
directions: Purée or froth pumpkin pie filling with heavy cream. Mix with other ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a martini glass. Rim with crumbled graham crackers and a cinnamon stick; top with a dash of cinnamon or nutmeg.

name: Sleepy Hollow Fizz
directions: Dry shake, shake with 3 ice cubes and strain into a tall glass. Top with club soda. No garnish.
Pumpkin purée:

Take one 15 oz can of Libby’s 100% pure pumpkin, add 1 tsp of ground cinnamon, ½ tsp of ground ginger, ¼ tsp of ground cloves and 15 oz of simple syrup and blend it all together in a blender or Cuisinart. Store in the fridge.

name: Sleepy Hollow Fizz
directions: Dry shake, shake with 3 ice cubes and strain into a fizz glass.
*Pumpkin purée:

Take one 15 oz can of Libby’s 100% pure pumpkin, add 1 tsp of ground cinnamon, ½ tsp of ground ginger, 1/4 tsp of ground cloves and 15 oz of simple syrup and blend it all together in a blender or Cuisinart. Store in the fridge.

name: Skyyscraper
directions: Fill a collins glass with ice add Vodka. Fill with lemonade and float the blue curaçao on top.

name: SKYY Violet
ingredients: dry sparkling wine (such as Drusian prosecco)
Fee Brothers or angostura orange bitters
directions: Stir Skyy vodka, orange bitters and creme de violette with ice. Strain into champagne coup or flute and top with prosecco. Top with zest of an orange and garnish with orange twist.

name: Skinny Spiked Cider
directions: Build in a tall glass filled with ice. Stir.

name: Skyy Infusions Pineapple Product Release
directions: In an ice filled shaker combine all ingredients, shake and strain into ice fill scorpion bowl. Garnish with a floating orchid and pineapple.

name: Skinny Santa
directions: Build in a tall glass filled with ice. Stir.
APPROX CALORIES: 100

name: Skinny Mini
ingredients: of Crystal Light, Orange Sunrise flavor
directions: Blend together vodka, crystal light, fruit and ice. Pour into tall glass. Add fruit to garnish. Sip and Enjoy!
Makes 6-8 cocktails, 150 calories, 6 g of carb, 2 g of fiber per drink!

name: Skinny Jack-O-Lantern
directions: Shake ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker.
Strain into a martini glass.
Garnish with fat-free whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice.

name: Skellini
directions: Combine 42 Below Vodka, raspberry liqueur and juice in a champagne flute, and stir well. Top with champagne sparkling wine and serve.

name: Singapore Sling
directions: Combine gin, lemon juice, and sugar in a shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into a chilled collins glass filled with ice. Fill with soda and float the cherry liqueur/brandy on top.

name: Silent Night
directions: Shake all ingredients and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with 3 kona coffee beans.

name: Silver Screen Punch
ingredients: 1 (6 oz) can pink lemonade concentrate, partially thawed
1 pineapple, cut into rings and frozen
directions: In a blender, combine pink lemonade concentrate, pineapple juice, strawberries, and ginger. Blend until smooth. Pour into a punch bowl. Add vodka and stir to combine. Just before serving, pour in Moet & Chandon. Add frozen pineapple rings.

name: Sidra de la Mula (Apple Cider Mule)
Shrinking Violet Champagne Cocktail
directions: Pour the crème de violette in a champagne flute and top off with sparkling wine. Garnish with an edible flower like pansy, violet, or viola.

name: Shot with a Beer Back
ingredients: tequila, whiskey, vodka, or whatever spirit you choose
directions: Pour shot in, well, a shot glass and the beer in a beer glass. Drink both. Repeat.

name: Shirley Temple
directions: Pour the lemon lime soda into a highball glass (or collins glass) filled with ice.  Add grenadine (make sure that it’s non-alcoholic) and stir.  Add maraschino cherries (make sure to give the kiddies extra).
For a twist, substitute the grenadine for maraschino cherry juice (you can purchase it or use the juice from the cherries).  It’s a DOTW fave.

name: Shire Flower
directions: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake until ice cold. Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with small, white flowers.

name: Shark Attack
directions: Mix everything in a large pitcher or punch bowl. Serve over ice in a chilled Collins Glass with cocktail umbrellas. Don’t put your feet in the water! Makes 15–20 servings.

name: Shira-la-la-la-az
directions: Pour the wine into a large pot heat over a low flame. Add sugar and spices as the wine begins to warm. Stir until sugar is dissolved and add brandy. Heat thoroughly but do not boil! Add orange zest. Let steep for 45 minutes over very low heat. More sugar may be added to taste at this time, stir well to dissolve. Serve hot and garnish with an orange slice. To intensify flavors, steep in the refrigerator overnight and serve hot the next day.

name: Shamrock Shake
directions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend on high for 20 seconds. Pour into a chilled margarita or collins glass. Garnish with a mint sprig or a four-leaf clover.

name: Shamrock #3
directions: Combine all the ingredients into a blender, blend for 20 to 30 seconds or until smooth. Pour into a chilled red wine glass or large wine goblet.

name: Shamrock #1
ingredients: Dash of green crème de menthe
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, stir and strain into a chilled martini glass.

name: Shamrock #2
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake well and pour into an old-fashioned glass.

name: Shady Lady
directions: Combine in a collins or highball glass with ice. Stir well.

name: Sgroppino – Italian Cocktail
directions: Pour the prosecco and vodka into 2 champagne flutes, diving equally. Spoon a scoop of sorbet into each flute. Sprinkle with mint and serve immediately.

name: Sgroppino
directions: In the metal tin of a boston shaker combine sorbet and vodka by slowly whisking the vodka into the sorbet.   Pour into a chilled champagne flute and add proescco.  Stir gently and serve.

name: Sex Wax
directions: Mix over crushed ice in collins glass.

name: Sex on the Beach (West Coast Version)
directions: Fill a bucket or collins glass with ice. Add vodka and peach schnapps. Fill with equal parts of the juices and garnish with a cherry.

name: Sex On The Beach (East Coast)
directions: Fill a bucket or collins glass with ice. Add vodka and peach schnapps. Top with orange juice. Float melon liqueur on top. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Sex a’ Peel
directions: Muddle and strain banana. Add banana juice with simple syrup and balsamic vinegar in a cocktail shaker. Add Rémy Martin V.S.O.P and ice. Shake well and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with lemon twist.

name: Sesame Nog
ingredients: Garnish: Black and White whole Sesame Seeds
directions: Add yolks to blender and let blend on slowest speed until yolks are very well
blended. Slowly add sugar and half 1/4 part of cream and then let blend 2
minutes until sugar dissolves and mixture completely emulsifies. Then add rest
of cream, milk, ground Sesame, Brandy. Blend another 3 minutes. Then refrigerate
in glass jar. Serve chilled without ice
GROUND SESAME
Measure 1/2 cup white Sesame Seeds. Put in non-stick frying pan
and place over med heat. Flip the seeds every 30 seconds or so in pan until
aroma is intensified and Sesame is light golden in color. Shut heat, put in
separate bowl and let cool. After that place seeds in coffee
grinder and grind seeds until powdery. Make sure to grind in intervals as to not
turns into paste.
Created by Mixologist Jason Walsh

name: Sergeant Whiskey Sowers
directions: Slice cherry from top to bottom five times around pit, and soak in a cup of Wild Turkey American Honey. Combine Wild Turkey Bourbon, grapefruit juice, lime juice and honey in a cocktail shaker. Froth egg white and add a dollop to the mixture. Shake and serve over ice. Garnish with Wild Turkey American Honey-soaked cherry.

name: Screwed-Up Screwdriver
directions: Place ice in a highball glass. Pour juice into glass. Pour vodka over the back of a cocktail spoon into glass so it sits on top of juice. Slice ends off a licorice twist and use as a straw.

name: September Sour – Celebrate Bourbon Heritage Month
directions: Combine all ingredients into a mixing tin and shake well.
Strain the liquid into a coupe glass.
Float red wine on top of cocktail

name: September Spice
directions: Muddle all ingredients together, add ice, shake well and strain into an old fashioned glass over fresh ice.  Garnish with a Habanero slice.

name: Scream Soda
directions: Add spiced rum and lemon-lime soda in tall ice-filled glass. Garnish with lemon and lime slices if desired.

name: Screwdriver
directions: In a highball or bucket glass filled with ice, pour vodka, then fill with orange juice.

name: Scotch Spice
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker full of ice and shake for 15–20 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick if desired.

name: Scream
directions: Shake contents and strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Scooby Snack
directions: Shake ingredients in a mixing cup with ice. Strain into 7 oz rocks glass and serve over ice.

name: Scottish Grasshopper
directions: In a mixing tin half-filled with ice, add
Drambuie
Green Crème de Menthe
White Crème de Cacao
Shake until tin is frosted (about 20 seconds),
add: 1 oz. Half-and-Half
Swirl to chill, strain into a chilled martini glass, drizzle ¼ oz. Green Crème de Menthe over top.

name: Scary Sangria
directions: Slice apples and insert whole cloves directly into the fruit.
Combine all fruit slices in a glass pitcher and slowly pour in brandy, rum, and wine. Cover and chill from 2-24 hours (the longer, the better!)
Before serving, add sparkling cider and orange juice. Stir gently and serve over ice.
Makes about 15 servings

name: Sazerac
ingredients: absinthe or anise-flavored liquor (such as Pernod, Herbsaint or anisette)
directions: Pour the absinthe into a chilled old fashioned glass, swirl the liquor around the glass until the glass is coated. Add the sugar, water and bitters and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes, add the bourbon, stir well and add a twist of lemon.

name: Satan’s Whiskers
