directions: Stir with ice, then strain into a stemmed cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist.

name: Sangue Frio (Cold Blood)
ingredients: ¼ green apple cut in small cubes
directions: Combine all ingredients over ice. Mix and strain into an appropriately ghoulish glass.

name: Samantha Jones’ Community Service
directions: Shake ingredients over ice and strain into a chilled, sugar-rimmed martini glass. Sprinkle with coconut flakes and garnish with two cherries.

name: Sangre de Avión
directions: Muddle mint in shaker. Add blackberries and gently press with muddler to pulverize. Build remaining ingredients in shaker, shake vigorously. Fine strain into cocktail glass, garnish with mint leaf. (Try substituting lime juice for the lemon juice as a margarita variation.)

name: Sandeman’s Sweetheart Sparkler
directions: Serve in a chilled champagne flute. Add sparkling wine and top with the port.

name: Samantha
directions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Rim glass with mixture of salt and small amount of white pepper. No garnish.

name: Salty Dog
directions: Combine gin or vodka and grapefruit juice in a shaker filled with ice and shake. Salt the rim of a highball glass filled with ice and pour the drink into the highball glass.

name: Saint Valentine
ingredients: good, flavorful white rum such as Banks 5 Island
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Rusty Nail
directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Always pour the Drambuie last to allow it to mix with the lighter scotch. Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and strain into a cocktail glass for a straight-up Nail.

name: Rumjito
ingredients: Flor de Caña 7 Year Grand Reserve Rum
directions: Muddle mint leaves, superfine sugar and lime in a mixing glass. Add Flor de Caña, CAMUS and ice in a cocktail shaker and shake. Strain into a tall glass filled with ice. Top with tonic water and garnish with a sprig of mint. Sugarcane syrup can be used to replace superfine sugar.

name: Running Mate
directions: 1. Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and shake.
2. Strain into a martini glass.
3.Garnish with two raspberries and one blueberry on a tooth pick.

name: Rum Berry
ingredients: Flor de Caña 7 Year Grand Reserve
directions: Muddle cucumber and strawberry in cocktail shaker until the strawberry is pulverized. Add remaining ingredients and shake vigorously with ice. Strain over fresh ice into old fashioned glass. Prop slice of fresh strawberry onto rim of glass.

name: Rouge Martini
ingredients:
1 part(s) Pinnacle Blueberry Vodka
1 part(s) Pinnacle Pomegranate Vodka
2 part(s) cranberry juice
½ part(s) fresh squeezed lime juice
directions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Rum Yum
directions: Combine in a rocks glass over ice or blend with a scoop of ice and serve in a large cocktail glass.

name: Rosé the Riveter
directions: Shake with ice and strain into tall glass filled with cracked ice. Garnish with lime wheel and straw.
*Honey syrup
Mix equal parts honey and water for a simple syrup. Do not heat up. Let dissolve naturally.

name: Root Beer Floatini
directions: Shake hard over ice & strain into glass. Float a melon-ball size scoop of vanilla ice cream in center.

name: Romney Hood Cocktail
directions: Muddle mint and simply syrup in the bottom of  rocks glass  Mix all together and top off with a splash of soda. Serve on the rocks in a tall glass rimmed with sugar. Garnish with a lime wedge

name: Root Beer Float
directions: pour over ice or mix vodka and rootbeer and add the ice cream
= yum

name: Rocket Fuel
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a shot glass.

name: Roasted Orange Negroni Sbagliato
directions: Place the orange in a mixing glass and add vermouth. Muddle the two so that the charred bits are released into the vermouth. Add Campari and ice, and stir. Strain into a chilled rocks glass that is filled with ice and top with sparkling wine. Do not stir as this will dissipate the bubbles. Garnish with orange peel.
*Roasted Orange Wedge
Directions:

Slice oranges into wedges and place in a sealable container. Top with sweet red vermouth and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, remove oranges from the vermouth and char on a grill until the sugar caramelizes and black specks form on the oranges.

name: Rob Roy (Scotch Manhattan)
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry. Can also be served on ice in a rocks glass and built right in the glass.
Dry Rob Roy:
- substitute dry vermouth for the sweet vermouth, garnish with an olive.
Perfect Rob Roy:
- use ¼ oz of both sweet and dry vermouth, garnish with a lemon twist

name: Roaring ’20s
directions: Pour rum, ginger liqueur, and lime juice into a rocks or highball glass filled with ice. Stir and top off with a splash with soda.

name: Road Kill
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a shot glass.

name: Ring of Kerry
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake well and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with shaved chocolate.

name: Rickey
directions: Pour gin and lime juice into a high ball glass over ice. Fill with club soda. Garnish with a lime wedge. If necessary, you can substitute brandy, rum, vodka, tequila, or whiskey for the gin.

name: Rich Bourbon-Brandy Egg Nog
directions: Separate two of the eggs. Whisk together six whole eggs, two egg yolks, sugar and salt. Heat two cups of the heavy cream with all of the milk over medium-low heat. Whisk in one cup of the milk-cream into the egg mixture. Then pour this into the rest of the milk-cream mixture and continue to cook, stirring until the mixture thickens—about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove the pan from the stove and strain the through a fine-mesh sieve. Allow to cool for 10 minutes.

Add the vanilla, nutmeg, bourbon and brandy and stir. Beat two egg whites to soft peaks in a clean mixing bowl and fold them in. In a separate bowl, beat ½ cup cream to soft peaks and fold that in. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, about 1 hour.
Then you’re done! Pour into a pitcher or bowl and garnish individual servings with nutmeg.

name: Rhubarb Cosmo
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wedge or part of a rhubarb stalk.
*Rhubarb Syrup (makes 1 1/2 cups)
Ingredients:
1 ½ cups water
5 stalks rhubarb, chopped into half-inch pieces
¾ cup cane sugar
Directions:

Boil all ingredients, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. (The rhubarb will separate and turn into mush, which you can use in baking.) Remove from heat and let the mixture steep for 10 minutes. Strain the solids with a fine-mesh sieve or cheese cloth. Keep the syrup in a glass jar in the refrigerator. Add a tablespoon of vodka to preserve it longer. Note about rhubarb: Always discard the leaves, as they are not edible.

name: Renegade
directions: Combine all in a shaker half-filled with ice. Shake well and strain into a tall glass nearly filled with ice. As a bonus this week, a cooking with booze special from the Cabo Wabo Cantina! Enjoy!

name: Regent’s Punch
directions: Combine the brandy, rum, arrack, maraschino liqueur, pineapple syrup, sugar, lemon peel and orange peel in a bowl.  In a separate bowl, pour the boiling water over the green tea, allow to combine (5-10 minutes) and strain into the first bowl.  Add Champagne.  Serve in punch cups over ice.

name: Red-Headed Slut: RIP
directions: Poor the Jäegar in a highball glass filled with ice, follow with cranberry juice. Top with peach schnapps and garnish with a cherry. Or split between 2 shot glasses.

name: Red-Headed Miranda
ingredients: A squeeze of fresh lemon juice
directions: Shake over ice and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a fresh mint leaf.

name: Red, White & Blue
directions: Build in a pony tall shot glass. Beginning with the framboise, layer each successive ingredient on top using the back of a spoon.

name: Red, White, & Blue Cocktail
directions: Sugar the rim of a chilled martini glass. Combine all ingredients except the blue curaçao in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into the martini glass. Drop in a splash of blue curaçao.
*Macerated strawberries
1 pint of strawberries, washed and sliced
1 tablespoon of sugar
Dash of balsamic vinegar

name: Red Zone Refresher
directions: In a cocktail shaker, muddle a lemon slice, a lime slice, and four orange slices. Fill shaker with ice and add Ketel One Citroen, Grand Marnier, and grapefruit juice. Shake vigorously and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice. Top off with club soda, garnish with an orange wedge and enjoy.

name: Red Snapper
directions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a rocks or highball glass.

name: Red Zone
directions: Combine ingredients and garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Red Zombie
ingredients: Pinch of kosher salt and freshly-ground black pepper
directions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into martini glass. Garnish with green eyeballs*, laid across the rim of the glass.

*Cut the end of a stalk of celery so it measures 5–6 inches long and split the stick in half lengthwise. Slide the green olives into two lychee fruits to make eye balls and push the thin celery stick through both as garnish.

name: Red Rose Martini
directions: 1. Shake all ingredients with ice
2. Strain into chilled martini glass
3. Garnish with a single, elegant rose petal (optional)

name: Red Rooster Sour
ingredients: 1 heaping bar spoon of spicy mango chutney (¾ oz)
1 pinch of smoked chili salt (1/8 oz)
directions: Garnish with angostura aromatic bitters soaked “everything under the sun” dried red chili pepper skins. Dry shake, hard shake, fine strain into cocktail glass, garnish with “everything under the sun” dried red pepper skin soaked angostura aromatic bitters.

name: Red Light Lover
directions: Combine kiwi vodka, raspberry liqueur, and lemon in a cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into a champagne flute. Garnish with a lemon peel.

name: Red Over Heels
directions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled martini glass. Lay lemon peel twirl across the rim of the glass with cocktail pick.
*To create honey syrup, combine ½ oz water with ½ oz honey.

name: Red Hot Mama
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a shot glass for a shooter or into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice for a cocktail.

name: Red Devil
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Red Devil #2
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Red Death
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with a cup of ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Red Cicada
directions: Combine vodka and juice in a shaker with ice, mix well. Strain into a chilled wine or cocktail glass and top with champagne. Garnish with blueberry stuffed red raspberry.

name: Real Gold
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a shot glass.

name: Raspberry Twist
directions: Fill a cocktail shaker 1/2 way with ice. Combine all ingredients and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Raspberry Sparkler
directions: Muddle the raspberries with the lime juice and simple syrup at the bottom of a collins glass. Add Campari and tequila, then stir. Top with ice, then add blood orange soda.

name: Ramos Fizz
directions: Combine gin, cream, lemon juice, orange flavored syrup and powered sugar in a blender with 1/2 a cup of ice. Blend at a medium speed until smooth (15 to 20 seconds). Pour into a chilled highball or collins glass, top with the club soda, and serve with a slice of orange and maraschino cherry.

name: Raspberry Lemon Drop
directions: Moisten the rim of a chilled cocktail glass with a little lemon juice and dip in 1/2 of the sugar to frost. Mix vodka and remaining lemon juice and sugar in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into the cocktail glass. Float the Chambord on top. Drop in a fresh raspberry or two to garnish.

name: Quick Kick
directions: Pour ingredients into a tall glass with ice. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Quicky
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a cocktail or martini glass or an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Queen of Mexico
directions: Combine everything except the nutmeg in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or a old-fashioned glass if serving on the rocks. Grate some fresh nutmeg on top and garish with a wedge of pineapple, lime or an orange wheel.

name: Queen of Hearts
directions: Shaken with ice, strained into a champagne flute and topped with champagne.

name: Quarter Deck Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Quaker’s Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Quaker City Cooler
directions: Combine vodka, chablis, sugar syrup, lemon juice and vanilla extract in a shaker filled with ice, shake and pour into a chilled red wine goblet. Top with grenadine.

name: Put the Lime in Tea Coconut
directions: Shake all liquid ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into glass containing ice and top off with lime wheels.
*Green tea syrup:
1 part water
1 part sugar
1 green tea bag

Bring the water and sugar to a boil, then reduce heat and put in the green tea bag. Let simmer for 5 minutes then turn off heat. Leave the bag steeping for an additional 10 minutes, then remove and store syrup in a glass container in the refrigerator.

name: Purple Hooter
directions: This drink is typically served as a shooter although it also great on the rocks or served up in a cocktail glass. Any way you choose to prepare this drink your head will spin like an owl’s after few. Build in a mixing glass with ice. Blend & strain into shot, cocktail or rocks glass.

name: Purple Hooter
directions: Blend & strain into shot, cocktail or rocks glass.

name: Punch in the Stomach
directions: Mix wet ingredients in shaker and pour into regular chilled glass over cherries. Top with pineapple slice. Enjoy!

name: Pumpkin’s Passion
directions: Combine ingredients in mixing tin with ice, cap and shake. Pour into a margarita glass and garnish with a wedge of orange and a dash of cinnamon.

name: Pumpkin Spice
directions: Combine all ingredients except ginger slice in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain over fresh ice into a collins glass. Add long slice of ginger into glass lengthwise for garnish.

name: Pumpkin Pie
directions: Mix ingredients in blender with ice and blend thoroughly. Pour into graham cracker-rimmed highball glass and garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon.

name: Pumpkin Margarita
directions: Blend all together until smooth, pour into a 16 ounce (1-pint) glass, and garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Pumpkin Martini
directions: Shake with ice in a cocktail shaker.
Strain into a martini glass.
Garnish with fat-free whipped cream and a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice.

name: Pumpkin Martini
directions: Combine all ingredients over ice and shake. Strain in to martini glass, and garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Pumpkin Horchata
ingredients:
1.5oz Wild Turkey 101 Bourbon
2.5oz Pumpkin Horchata
Garnish: Sprinkle top with fresh ground nutmeg
Glass: Snifter
directions: Combine Bourbon and Pumpkin Horchata into shaker cup with 6 ice cubes. Strain into Snifter glass.
Top with fresh ground nutmeg.
Sip, enjoy and Happy Halloween.

name: Prickly Peartini
directions: Shaken, not stirred, with a sugared rim.

name: Prairie Fire
directions: Pour tequila into a chilled shot glass and add Tabasco.

name: Pumpkin Cocktail
directions: For the cinnamon brown sugar syrup, dissolve equal parts cinnamon sugar and boiling water.  Let cool and then strain.
Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake into cold.  Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with cinnamon brown sugar.

name: Pumpkin Caipirinha
directions: In a cocktail shaker, shake all ingredients vigorously with ice. Strain into a frosted cocktail glass. Garnish with a dash of nutmeg and cinnamon.

name: Proper Irish Whiskey
directions: No ice. Serve in a tumbler.

name: Pop’s Milk Punch
directions: Served cold. Make accordingly to the size of your Dad’s thermos.

name: Preserved Bliss
directions: first place your cucumber in a pint glass and muddle well, then combine all other ingredients. add 4 ice cubes then shake well.
strain into a highball glass over fresh ice.
then garnish with cucumber wheel

name: Pornstar
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice, stir gently and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Drink should be a purple-blueish color. You can change the sweetness of drink by the amount of grenadine put in. Enjoy!

name: Pop Rocks
ingredients: Pop Rocks, flavor of your choice
directions: Rim shot glass with Pop Rocks, fill with 1 part tequila.

name: Pomegranate Martini
directions: Shake all ingredients well with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Place pomegranate fruit in glass as garnish.

name: Pomegranate Grapefruit Campari Cocktail
directions: Combine ice, grapefruit juice, pomegranate juice, lime juice, and Campari in a shaker and give it a good shake. Pour into a martini glass or champagne flute. Garnish with a lime wheel and drop some pomegranate seeds into the glass.

name: Pome ‘n Tonic
directions: Combine all gin, Pama, juice and bitters in a mixing glass with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Top with tonic. Can also be served on the rocks.
Like it? How would you make it better? Let us know in the comments.

name: Polamalu Punch
directions: Shake over ice and strain into a martini glass.

name: Poinsettia Cocktail
directions: Add chilled Cointreau and cranberry to chilled Champagne glass. Stir and top with Champagne just before serving. Spice it up by adding 1 oz of vodka. For a non-alcoholic version, use ginger ale in place of Champagne and Cointreau.

name: Pogo Stick
directions: Fill a collins or highball glass with crushed ice. Add gin and fill with equal parts of grape juice and grapefruit juice. Rock candy on a stick is the recommended garnish; however, a regular stir stick will do.

name: Plum Smash
ingredients: 1 1/2 ripe purple plums, the juicier the better
directions: Thoroughly muddle the plum, thyme and simple syrup until the plum is juicy and the thyme has released its oils. Pour in bourbon and lemon juice, then shake with ice. Strain into a glass over more ice. Garnish with a thyme sprig, if desired.

name: Platorange
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a rocks glass over ice. Garnish with an orange twist. Enjoy!

name: Planter’s Punch
ingredients: Orange slice and cherry for garnish
directions: Combine 3 juices and rum in a shaker with ice. Shake well, and strain into an ice-filled collins glass. Top with grenadine. Garnish with an orange slice and a maraschino cherry. Personally, I prefer to simply drop the cherry in the punch, thus allowing it to soak up all that great flavor!
For a thirsty crowd, multiply the recipe by number of servings and serve in a pitcher with ice.

name: Pink Sophisticate
directions: Place two ounces of fresh, halved cranberries into an iSi Gourmet Whip canister with Purity Vodka.  Double charge and let sit for two minutes.  Rapidly release the gas and allow to sit until bubbling subsides.  Strain out solids.  Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake until ice cold.  Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with several Purity Vodka-infused cranberry halves.

name: Pisco Punch
directions: Mix all ingredients thoroughly in a shaker with ice. Pour into a punch or tall glass and garnish with pineapple.
For a party, make a batch in a large punch bowl. Just use the same proportions.

name: Pisco y Tamarindo
directions: Pour Pisco and Jarritos in a highball glass over ice. Add pinch of salt and squeeze of lime. Swirl and garnish with a lime or orange.

name: Pink Pineapple
directions: Blend all ingredients with ice in a blender for 20 seconds. Serve in a tall glass. Garnish with pineapple slice.

name: Pink Jesus
directions: Shake over is in a shaker, serve in a chilled shot glass.

name: Pink Panther
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and pour into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Pink Orleanade
directions: Combine the liquids and mint leaves in a shaker with ice. Shake and combine in a highball glass. Garnish with lemon and mint.

name: Pink Frost
directions: At the bottom of your cocktail shaker, muddle the strawberries with the liqueur. Pour in your other ingredients and add ice. Shake vigorously for at least 20 seconds. Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Optional: Rim glass with white chocolate.

name: Pineapple Mai Tai (AKA Pai Tai)
directions: Put ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker and shake for 30 seconds. Strain into glass and garnish with pineapple wedge and orchid.

name: Pineapple Martini
directions: In a cocktail shaker with ice, combine the vodka, pineapple and simple syrup. Shake hard and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple if you have it.

name: Pineapple Upside-Down Shot
directions: Mix rum and pineapple juice in shaker 50/50 each, strain into glass, and then add a small amount of grenadine and it will sink to the bottom, then enjoy.

name: Piña Perfection Margarita
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh rosemary for garnish
directions: 1. Muddle fresh rosemary into a cocktail shaker.
2. Add Don Julio añejo, fresh lime juice, fresh pineapple juice, and simple syrup into the cocktail shaker.
3. Shake well and strain into a highball glass.
4. Garnish with sprig of fresh rosemary.

name: Pinata
directions: Pour tequila into a collins glass filled with ice. Fill with pineapple juice. Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

name: Piña Martinique
directions: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Mix at high speed for 45 seconds. Pour into a collins glass. Garnish with a pineapple wedge or strawberry.

name: Piña Colada
directions: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender with the ice. Blend 20–30 seconds. Pour blended mixture into a collins glass. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and paper umbrella (of course!).

name: Pilgrim’s Pear
directions: Put gin and syrup in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Strain into a champagne flute and top off with Prosecco. For garnish, slice a Bosc pear lengthwise, halve one of the slices, and place both halves in the flute.
*Pear syrup
Ingredients:
1 cup water
1 Bosc pear, peeled and sliced
1 cup sugar
Instructions:

Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan and bring to a boil. Once pears are fully cooked (approximately 10 minutes), strain out the pears and refrigerate the liquid. That’s your syrup. Pear slices can be used as a dessert topping.

name: Pimm’s Cup
directions: Fill a collins glass (about 12 oz glass) with ice. Add Pimm’s and lemonade, then top off with lemon-lime soda. Garnish with a cucumber slice.
*Make your own lemonade by mixing 2 oz fresh lemon juice with 1 oz simple syrup.

name: Peppermint Martini
directions: In a cocktail shaker, combine vodka, Peppermint HINT, cranberry juice, and ice; shake until well combined. Strain into chilled glass and top with seltzer water. Garnish with mint; serve immediately.

name: Peppermint Froth
directions: Shake all ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a rocks glass filled with crushed ice and garnish with a chocolate-covered peppermint candy stick. If you’re feeling decadent, top with whipped cream and crushed candy canes.

name: Peppermint Patty
ingredients:
1oz Patron XO Café Tequila
1oz Godiva Chocolate Raspberry Vodka
.5oz Crème De Menthe Green Liqueur
2oz Cream
directions: Combine all ingredients and serve on the rocks.

name: Penalty Kick
ingredients: Chocolate or ground coffee for garnish
directions: Layer ingredients into a shot glass: espresso first and then the Amarula. Garnish with a sprinkle of chocolate or ground coffee.

name: Peg Leg Punch
ingredients: 1 bottle of Brugal Extra Dry Rum
Highland Park 12 Year Old Scotch Whisky
directions: Pour all ingredients into large pitcher and add ice, chill for at least an hour, sweeten to taste, top off with champagne serve with an orange and lemon rind in chilled rocks glass with 1 large cube of ice. Serves 15 to 20.

name: Pear Sake Martini
directions: In a cocktail shaker, combine the sake, pear juice, and dry vermouth. Shake thoroughly with ice. Strain the drink into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of pear if desired.

name: Pearfect Season (New England Patriots)
ingredients: superfine sugar OR ½ part simple syrup
directions: Muddle blueberries and sugar/simple syrup in a mixing glass. Then add Pears and lemon juice, shake and strain over ice in a highball. Top with lemon-lime soda and optional dashes of bitters. Garnish with 3 blueberries and a mint sprig.

name: Pear-Way to Heaven
directions: Combine all ingredients in shaker and add ice. Shake thoroughly. Strain over crushed ice into martini glass.

name: Pearaschino Bourbon Cocktail
directions: In a shaker, combine the bourbon, maraschino liqueur, and pear syrup. Shake thoroughly with ice. Strain into a martini glass and top with ginger ale, about 1 oz. Garnish with a cherry.
*Pear syrup
Ingredients:
2 pears
1 c sugar
2 c water
2 tbs vodka (optional)
Instructions:
First, cut up the pears. Combine them with the sugar and water in a pot on the stove. Boil for about 10 minutes until the sugar dissolves and the syrup has a strong pear flavor.

Strain the pears from the syrup (you can also save the pears and use as an excellent topping on ice cream, yogurt, etc.). Transfer the syrup to a bottle. If you want it to last longer, add a little vodka to the syrup.

name: Peanut Manhattan
ingredients: The Bitter Truth Chocolate Mole Bitters
directions: Combine all ingredients in a Pint Glass, add 3, 1 inch cubes ice. Stir  –  20 complete rotations.
Strain into a cocktail glass or  coupe
Garnish with Maraschinos.

name: Peanut Jubilee
ingredients: Peanut infused aged rum (Barbancourt Aged Haitian Rhum)
Garnish: Lime boat (half lime cut in half and cored out. Add raspberries, blueberries and roasted unsalted peanut halves. Then drizzle with honey and add bamboo skewer.
directions: combine all ingredients in mixing glass with 5 ice cubes. Shake well and pour over crushed ice in special daiquiri type glass. Then apply garnishes, sip and enjoy.
Peanut infusion:
Take 2 parts roasted un-salted de-shelled peanuts and 1 part dark rum and combine in Mason style jar for 24 hours. Strain peanut solids out and store at room temperature.

name: Peach Twist
directions: Fill a cocktail shaker 1/2 way with ice. Combine all ingredients and shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. This cocktail can also be made with Stoli’s raspberry-flavored vodka.

name: Peach Toast
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker. Shake and strain into shot glasses. Serve each with a lime wedge.

name: Peaches and Cream
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into an old fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Peach Scotch Smash
ingredients: ½ of a ripe, yellow peach in chunks
directions: Muddle the peach, lemon and Cointreau in the bottom of a cocktail shaker. Add ice and the scotch, then shake. Strain into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Add peach slices and mint for garnish.

name: Patriotic Punch
directions: Combine and serve in a rocks glass over ice. For a non-alcoholic version, substitute cherry-flavored fruit juice for vodka.

name: Pau Hana Cocktails for the Tin Man Triathlete
Pass the Turkey
directions: Muddle sage and thyme with apple cider. Add ice, top with Wild Turkey and cranberry jelly. Shake well, strain over ice in a glass rimmed with turkey jus and breadcrumbs.

name: Partidge In A Pear Tree
directions: Mix ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Top with champagne.

name: Partridge in a Pear Tree
directions: Shake ingredients and add 1 tbsp champagne.

name: Park Avenue Princess
directions: Squeeze and drop half a lemon into a cocktail shaker. Add Skyy Infusions vodka and 7 Up with ice and stir. Strain into a tall collins glass with fresh ice, and float red wine over top of drink.

name: Passion-Politan
directions: Combine all ingredients except champagne/sparkling wine in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously and add sparkling wine, stir and strain into a martini glass. Float the rose petal on top of the cocktail for garnish.

name: Papa Ghirardelli (SF Cocktail Week 2010)
directions: Combine Encanto pisco, Campari, rosato, Benedictine and lemon juice in an ice-filled shaker and shake for 10 to 15 seconds, or until chilled. Strain over fresh ice into a collins glass and top with seltzer. Garnish with a slice of orange.

name: Pacific Splash
directions: Fill a collins glass with ice and add vodka. Add juices.

name: Packer’s ROCKS
directions: Build over ice in a highball glass. Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: p.i.n.k. Leprechaun Martini
directions: Swirl chocolate syrup inside a well-chilled martini glass. Combine ingredients over chipped ice and shake well. Strain into glass.

name: Packer’s Punch
directions: Mix ingredients in a punch bowl with lots of ice.

name: p.i.n.k. peppermint martini
directions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a pink peppermint stick.

name: Osaka
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: Orangecello Champagne Cocktail
directions: Combine sugar and lime juice in large pitcher, stir to dissolve. Add rum, orangecello and mango juice. Chill. For a single drink pour 1 ½ oz of the rum mixture into a champagne flute add champagne to fill glass. Garnish with mango.

name: Oranje Firecracker
directions: Add Ketel One oranje, apricot nectar, fresh lime juice, simple syrup, and ground cayenne pepper to a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously until chilled. Pour into a rocks glass over fresh ice. Garnish with a lime slice.

name: Orange Sunset
directions: Combine gin, crème de banane and lemon juice in an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Fill with orange juice and stir.

name: Orange Bomber
directions: Mix together in a highball glass filled with ice and enjoy.

name: Orange Crush Cosmo
directions: In a mixing tin half-filled with ice, add:
Shake until tin is frosted, strain into a martini glass.

name: Orange Crush
directions: Combine vodka and triple sec in an old fashioned glass filled with ice, fill with orange juice and stir.

name: Orange Orange
directions: Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add vodka. Fill with orange juice. Garnish with an orange slice.

name: Orange Bourbon Press
directions: In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the orange slice (remove the rind and set it aside to be used as the garnish) and a splash of soda water. Add bourbon and Grand Marnier. Stir. Add ice and top with equal parts soda water and ginger ale. Stir again. Garnish with an orange twist.

name: Orange Blossom
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into an old fashioned or highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with the orange slice.

name: Opera
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: One Night Stand
directions: Fill a cocktail shaker two-thirds full of ice. Combine the vodka and pucker and shake well. Strain over ice into a highball glass. Top with cranberry juice and Sprite.

name: Olé
directions: Combine tequila, coffee liqueur and soda in a mixing glass, stir and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Float cream on top by pouring it over the back of a spoon into the martini or cocktail glass.

name: Old Sydney-Town Punch
ingredients:
1.5oz Bols Genever
.5oz St. Elizabeth’s Allspice Dream
.75oz lemon juice
.5oz orange juice
.5oz pineapple gum syrup
directions: Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, fill with ice and shake well for 10 seconds. Strain into a punch glass and serve up with a slight grate of nutmeg.
*To make hot, Strain above into a hot pot and then serve the same way. Or in lieu of ice, add 1.5oz of hot water and shake, strain and serve.
Multiply by #of guest and drinks per guest to make a bowl full!

name: Ocean Dream
directions: Build in a highball glass filled with ice. First pour gin and then the juices. Stir. Garnish with an orange slice or pineapple wedge.

name: Oatmeal Cookie
directions: Pour schnapps into a large shot glass. Layer the remaining ingredients on top of the schnapps by pouring slowly over the back of a spoon.

name: Nutty Stinger
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake, and strain into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Oak Room Special
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and pour into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Nutty Professor
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, swirl, and strain into a large shot glass.

name: Nutty Irishman
directions: Pour the ingredients into a mixing glass half filled with ice. Cool the liquids by swirling it in the glass. Strain in to a rocks glass. Shoot it. Repeat!

name: Nude Beach
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Mix well and strain into a chilled collins glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a lime squeeze.

name: Nut House
ingredients: Finlandia cranberry vodka or cranberry-infused vodka
directions: Pour vodka into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice, add amaretto and stir.

name: Nine to Five Punch
directions: 1. Add Basil Hayden’s Bourbon, pineapple juice, lemon juice, maple syrup and bitters in a medium punch bowl.
2. Stir ingredients until maple syrup has fully dissolved.
3. Add a few large ice cubes, club soda and float lemon and pineapple slices on top.

name: Nirvana
directions: Combine rum, grenadine and simple syrup in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled collins glass filled with ice. Top with grapefruit juice and stir gently.

name: Nightmare
directions: In a shaker filled with a cup of ice, pour the gin, vermouth, brandy and orange juice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Newport Cooler
directions: Pour gin, brandy, peach liqueur and lime juice in a collins glass filled with ice. Top with ginger ale and stir gently.

name: NFC Herradura Margarita
directions: Frost the rim of a glass with sugar. Mix all ingredients in a blender for a few minutes. Decorate with a lime slice.

name: Newbury
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled ith ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

name: New Year’s Swanky Toast
ingredients: Top with brut-style champagne (or extra dry-style for a sweeter taste)
directions: Pour the vodka, creme de cassis and cranberry juice in a shaker tin with half cup of ice and stir gently and strain into a flute or cocktail-martini glass. Top up with 2–3 of chilled champagne. Garnish with 3 fresh cranberries floating on the drink.

Note: for an incredible “luxurious effect” coat the cranberry berries with 23 karat edible gold. Put some berries in a sandwich bag then add some gold flakes, seal the bag ad shake for 4-5second, the berries are now gold-coated.

name: New Yorker
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Mix well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: New Year’s Sparkler
directions: Combine SKYY Infusions Passion Fruit and pomegranate juice in a chilled champagne flute and top with champagne. Garnish with raspberry tree.*
*Slide 5-6 raspberries onto long skewer and place vertically in champagne glass.

name: New Year in Lambeth
directions: Add the first five ingredients into a highball glass and stir. Fill the glass with ice and top with Champagne. Garnish with an orange wheels.

name: Nervous Breakdown
directions: Combine vodka, Chambord and cranberry in a collins or other tall glass filled with ice. Fill with soda. Garnish with an orange slice.

name: New Orleans Buck
directions: Pour or squeeze the orange juice and lime juice into a chilled old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Add the gin, fill the glass with ginger ale, stir gently, and garnish with the lime slice.

name: Nelson’s Blood
directions: Pour the champagne and port into a chilled champagne glass.

name: Nectarine of the Gods
ingredients: 1 Nectarine seeded and cut into quarters
1 Whole lime cut into 6 large wedges
directions: In a cocktail shaker, add ½ the nectarine quarters and 4 lime wedges. Pour in simple syrup and muddle fruits to a paste. Add mint leaves and muddle lightly without tearing. Add Denizen Rum and ice. Shake and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with mint sprigs and a wedge of lime.

name: Navy Seal
directions: Mix together and serve in three shot glasses. Have two buddies drink them with you.

name: Navy Seal
directions: Mix together and serve in three shot glasses. Have two buddies drink them with you.

name: Naughty Nog
directions: Combine all liquid ingredients in blender. Blend until smooth. Pour in glass and dust with nutmeg.

name: Napoléon
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Napa Sun
directions: Muddle basil leaves the sugar in a mixing glass. Dissolve sugar-basil mix into the vodka and add the orange juice. Shake strain into a champagne flute, fill with chardonnay.

name: Napa Valley Breeze
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker, shake well. Serve on the rocks in a highball glass.

name: Mumtini
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a wide strip of grapefruit peel.

name: Mulled Cider
directions: Combine ingredients in a saucepan and heat over medium heat. Stir occasionally, don’t let it get to hot. Once the mixture is thoroughly heated, strain into a mug. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Want to make enough for a group?
Ingredients:
1 bottle (750 ml) gold rum
1 ½ gallon apple cider or juice
2 tbsp honey
12 cloves
1 tsp allspice
12 cinnamon sticks
Directions:

Combine ingredients in a soup pot or electric crock pot and heat over medium heat. Stir occasionally, don’t let it get to hot. Once the mixture is thoroughly heated turn on low. Float lemon and apple slices on top. Serve in glass mugs.

name: Mudslide
directions: Combine in a rocks glass with ice. Add, and drink quickly through, a straw. Repeat!

name: Mr. Bigtini
directions: Pour Prairie into a shaker over ice and strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish with three organic olives.

name: Mr. Manhattan
directions: Combine Skyy Infusions cherry vodka, Wild Turkey bourbon whiskey and cola in a cocktail shaker with ice and stir. Pour into a double rocks glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

name: Mountain Tea
directions: Build in a coffee mug. Serve with a cinnamon stick and sliced lemon.

name: Mounds Bar
directions: Pour over ice in a highball or bucket glass and sip!

name: Mr. Big
directions: Shake with ice and strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with a peach slice.

name: Mother’s Little Helper
directions: Mix the Maker’s Mark, peach schnapps and sliced peaches in large pitcher (at least 2 quarts). Let mixture sit for at least 15 minutes to meld flavors. Garnish with peaches and enjoy! Makes one pitcher, about 6 – 8 cocktails.

name: Mother Earth Mint
directions: 1. Add the cucumber and mint to a cocktail shaker and muddle to release the flavors.
2. Fill cocktail shaker with ice and add Moon Mountain Vodka, lime juice, and agave syrup.
3. Shake vigorously and strain into an old-fashioned glass.
4. Garnish with a slice of cucumber and mint sprig.

name: Morning with Leprechauns
ingredients: cold black coffee (strengthened to your likeness)
directions: Combine all the ingredients into a highball glass filled almost to the top with crush ice and stir well.

name: Moscow Mule
directions: Add vodka and lime juice to a chilled beer mug with ice. Fill with ginger beer. Garnish with a lime wedge.

name: Moontini
directions: Mix in a shaker with ice. Mix well. Strain and serve straight-up in chilled martini glass.

name: Monkey Gland
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Monkey Fizz
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a into a pint glass filled with fresh ice. Top with a splash of soda.

name: Monkey Gland
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Monsieur Hayden
directions: 1. Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker with ice and shake.
2. Strain into a cocktail glass.
3. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Monkey Driver
directions: Fill a highball or collins glass with ice. Pour in vodka and schnapps. Top with orange juice. Stir well.

name: MOMosa
directions: Combine Frangelico Hazelnut Liqueur and passion fruit juice with ice and shake well; strain into a champagne flute.  Top off the cocktail with Champagne Laurent-Perrier Brut L-P and enjoy.

name: Mojito X
directions: Muddle the mint leaves, simple syrup and lime juice at the bottom of a highball glass. Add X-Rated Fusion and soda and stir. Add ice and garnish with a lime & mint sprig.

name: Mojito
directions: Combine lime juice, mint and sugar in a collins or highball glass. Stir gently to bruise the mint. Fill glass ¾ with ice. Add the rum. Top with soda. Stir well.

name: Modern Margarita
directions: In a mixing glass add muddle fruit, add tequila, cointreau, agave nectar,add ice and shake, pour in a chilled martini glass. Garnish with a orange zest.

name: Mistletoe Mulled Wine
ingredients:
1 bottle of Skinnygirl Red Wine
 3 cinnamon sticks, broken in half
of cloves
tablespoon
 3 star anise
 1 whole nutmeg cracked into two pieces
 1 orange peel
 Agave Nectar to taste
directions: Pour wine into pan and cook over low heat
Make a sachet with the spices
Put sachet in pan and simmer for 30 min.
Add agave nectar to taste
Pour wine through strainer
Serve in a heat proof glass
Garnish with cinnamon stick and orange peel
*Makes 6 servings

name: Mocha Bulldog
directions: Combine ingredients and serve over ice in a tall (collins) glass.

name: Mistletoe Punch
directions: Fill a mug half way with hot water. Add a table spoon of honey. Stir in thoroughly. Finally, mix in ingredients. Stir and serve.
For a party:
½ bottle (375 ml) dark rum
½ bottle (375 ml) cognac
½ bottle (375 ml) tawny port
6 – 8 cups water (adjust for desired strength)
½ cup honey

In a large saucepan, heat water to a boil. Reduce heat and add the honey stir until it is dissolved. Mix in the rum, cognac, and port. Leave on low heat to serve or transfer to an electric crock pot. Serves 20.

name: Miss Sunshine
directions: Combine vodka and lemon juice in a shaker with ice. Shake well and serve in a chilled shot glass.

name: Mistletoe
directions: Serve in a chilled champagne glass and garnish with pomegranate seeds.

name: Miranda
directions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled stem less flute. Garnish with a large lemon twist.

name: Mimosa
directions: In a chilled champagne glass, pour equal parts orange juice and champagne.

name: Mind Eraser
directions: Pour coffee liqueur and vodka into a chilled old fashioned glass, fill with club soda or sparkling water and stir. Drink quickly through a straw.

name: Millennium Martini
ingredients: Stoli Gold vodka or any other premium vodka
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice, mix well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Milk & Honey Cocktail
directions: Cold: Pour Benedictine into a mug, add ice, and top up with cold milk. Garnish with a slice of orange and cinnamon
Hot: Top Benedictine off with hot milk.

name: Midori’s Merry Martini
directions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Mikado
directions: Combine everything in a shaker with ice. Mix well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass or an old-fashioned glass filled with ice.

name: Midnight Rider
directions: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass. Add ice and shake. Strain into a tall glass. Garnish with an orange wedge.

name: Midori Shamrock
directions: Serve in a highball over ice. Garnish with a lemon.

name: Midori Sour
directions: Build in a high-ball glass filled with ice.

name: Midnight Cocktail
directions: Fill a champagne flute with chilled champagne, leave room at the top. Pour in the Goldschlager making sure to include an few flakes of gold!

name: Midnight Blue Margarita
directions: Shake ingredients with ice in a cocktail shaker, then serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with blueberries speared on a cocktail toothpick.
*Blueberry syrup
.5 cups water
.5 cups sugar
.5 cups blueberries
Bring ingredients to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Let the mixture cool, then strain out blueberries.

name: Midnight
directions: Add the port to a pint glass, if you got a rounded Guinness glass even better, then fill with Guinness.

name: Mezcal Mai Tai
ingredients:
1oz Scorpion Silver Mezcal
1oz Atlantico Reserve Rum
1/4oz Curaçao
3/4oz Orgeat Syrup(House Made)
3/4oz Fresh Lime Juice
Garnish; Crispy mint sprig and orange crab twist
directions: In a shaker combine all ingredients and add ice, shake well. Then add crushed
ice to highball glass. Finally pour over crushed ice. Garnish, sip and enjoy!

name: Mexican Leprechaun
directions: Pour Cabo Wabo Tequila and lime juice into a mixing glass half filled with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled martini glass. Top with ginger ale and garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Mexican Martini
directions: Pour all ingredients into a large cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake and strain into a large martini glass with a salt rim. Add two olives on a spear and serve.

name: Mezcal Manhattan
ingredients:
2.5oz Scorpion Reposado Mezcal
1.5oz Antica Formula Carpano (Sweet Vermouth)
2 Dashes of Homemade Cherry Bitters
Garnish: a Maraschino Cherry
directions: In a pint glass combine all ingredients and add 4-5 ice cubes. Stir around 30 rotations then pour into a 5oz Martini or Manhattan glass. Add Maraschino cherry, sip and enjoy

name: Mexican Hot Chocolate
directions: Warm the milk and chocolate in a saucepan. Stir with a molinillo or whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture begins to boil. Remove from the heat and froth the chocolate with the molinillo or the whisk. Serve immediately in demi-tasse: 5 parts hot chocolate to 1 part tequila. Finish with dollop of whipped cream.

name: Mexican Hot Chocolate #2
ingredients: Silver tequila (this recipe uses Hornitos Plata)
directions: Warm the milk and chocolate in a saucepan. Stir with a whisk until the chocolate is melted and the mixture begins to boil. Remove from the heat and froth the chocolate with a whisk.
Add one part Hornitos Plata for every five parts of hot chocolate. Finish with dollop of whipped cream.

name: Mexican Coffee
directions: In a footed mug add the rum, kahlúa and sugar. Fill with coffee and stir gently. Top with a bit of whipped cream if you have sweet tooth.

name: Merry Mary
ingredients:
Skinnygirl™ Cucumber Vodka
parts
low-sodium tomato juice
parts
Splash of fresh lemon juice
Squeeze of fresh lime juice
Dash of Worcestershire sauce (to taste)
Dash of hot sauce
Sprinkle of celery salt
Lime wedge
Cucumber wedge
Celery stalk
directions: Combine all ingredients and pour into glass.
Garnish with lime, cucumber and celery stalk.

name: MexiCabo Hot Chocolate
directions: Pour all ingredients into a coffee cup. Stir well. Finish with dollop of whipped cream.

name: Merry Mint Muddle
directions: Muddle mint leaves with ice in a cocktail shaker. Add Seagram’s Escapes Wild Berries, vodka and cranberry juice and shake to combine. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a sprig of mint and a lime wedge.

name: Metate Margarita
ingredients: Metate* infused Tequila Don Julio Blanco
directions: 1. Combine infused Tequila Don Julio Blanco, fresh lime juice and agave syrup into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well.
2. Strain into a rocks glass (salted rim optional).
7 ounces Tequila Don Julio Blanco
6 g Dry Roasted Unsalted Peanuts
6 g Toasted Sesame Seeds
2 g Ancho Chile (seeds removed)
3 g Chipotle (seeds removed)
6 g Valrhona Cacao Nibs
Preparation:
1. Add infused Tequila Don Julio into a iSi Whipper (commonly used to make whipped cream and easily found in a kitchen supply store).
2. Charge the iSi Whipper twice with N2O and let stand for 5 minutes.
3. Vent the iSi Whipper upright to release the gas.
4. Open the iSi Whipper and pour any liquid that was expelled back in.
5. Allow all the N2O to vent for 5 additional minutes.
6. Strain contents through a fine mesh strainer or if there additional small particles, strain through a paper coffee filter.

name: Mellon Baller
directions: Muddle and strain watermelon. Add watermelon juice with simple syrup to a cocktail shaker. Add RÃ©my Martin V.S.O.P and ice. Shake well and strain into a martini glass.

name: Melon Ball
directions: Pour vodka into a collins glass filled with ice, fill almost with orange juice, float midori and stir gently. Garnish with the maraschino cherry.

name: Merry Irishman
directions: Serve over ice in a rocks glass. Garnish with candy cane.

name: Melange A Trois
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake to mix and pour (ice and all) into a rock glass.
Garnish with a lime and cherry.

name: Maui Fizz
directions: Combine with a scoop of ice in an electric mixer. Mix well (15–20 sec). Pour into a collins glass.

name: Mauna Kea Martini
directions: Combine in a mixing glass with ice. Stir gently and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Martini
ingredients: dry vermouth (use less vermouth for a drier martini)
directions: Combine all ingredients in cocktail shaker with ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with olive or lemon twist.
Shake or stir?
Shaking will result in a colder drink and more water dilution. The ingredients are of equal weight, so stirring is sufficient to mix the ingredients. Do whatever you like best.

name: Massacre
directions: Start by filling a highball glass with ice. Add the tequila and Campari. Top with ginger ale and stir well.

name: Martin Miller’s Sugar & Spice Martini
ingredients: Splash of brown sugar simple syrup
directions: Shake with ice. Serve in a martini (cocktail) glass that has been rimmed with a mixture of cinnamon, superfine sugar.

name: Margarita of Love
directions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Pour into margarita glass with a few ice cubes.
*Blueberry agave syrup
Ingredients:
½ cup water
1 ½ oz agave syrup
¼ cup blueberries
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Stain out solids and refrigerate the syrup. Add a tablespoon or more of vodka to make it last longer in the fridge.

name: Margarita
directions: In a shaker with ice combine tequila, triple sec, and lime juice. Shake well a strain into the cocktail glass.

name: Manhattan 101
directions: Muddle ginger, mint, powdered sugar and bitters in a cocktail shaker. Add Wild Turkey bourbon, vermouth and ice. Shake and strain into a chilled glass.

name: Maple Sweet & Sour
directions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Shake ingredients and strain into a cocktail glass. Spray Annisette Cordial on top of cocktail.

name: Manhattan
directions: Combine all ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Variations:
Dry Manhattan: substitute dry vermouth and an olive garnish
Perfect Manhattan: use half dry vermouth and half sweet vermouth and garnish with a lemon twist

name: Mango Margarita
directions: Peel the mango. Slice the fruit and put it into a blender of food processor. Discard the skin and the pit. Run the blender until the fruit is thoroughly mashed and juicy. Meanwhile, juice the orange and lime. In a cocktail shaker, combine all the ingredients and the ice. Shake hard to integrate. Remove the lid from the shaker (carefully—it can be messy) and pour all, including the ice, into a glass. Garnish with a lime twist if desired.

name: Mama’s Malibu Martini
directions: Shake well and serve up in a martini glass. Garnish with chocolate.

name: Malibu Vampire Kiss
directions: Shake with ice, strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with seasonal fruit.  (We used a black cherry.)

name: Malibu Sparkler
ingredients: Fill glass with chilled G.H. Mumm Champagne
directions: Shake Malibu, grapefruit juice and grenadine with ice. Strain into a champagne glass and fill up with G.H. Mumm. Garnish with a strawberry slice on the rim.

name: Malibu Breeze
directions: In a highball glass filled with ice, pour Malibu and grenadine then top with pineapple juice. Stir well. Garnish with a pineapple slice.

name: Maliboo Witch’s Brew
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well and serve into martini glass, garnish with Halloween gummi worms.

name: Maker’s Mark Egg Nog
directions: Separate eggs and beat yolks until creamy. Whip sugar into yolks. Beat whites until they stand in peaks, adding ½ cup additional sugar, if desired. Beat yolks and Maker’s Mark together, add whites. Beat cream. Add cream and milk to mixture. Add nutmeg to taste and garnish each cup with nutmeg. Makes 2 ½ gallons.

name: Magic Cooler
ingredients: 2 tbs Lipton peach iced tea concentrate (powder)
directions: Mix all the ingredients in a blender and serve in a tall glass with a sprig of mint and a lemon wedge.

name: Mai Tai
directions: Combine ingredients together in a shaker with ice. Serve over fresh ice in a double old fashioned glass. Garnish with a pineapple wedge & cherry. Can use store bought mix in place of the Orgeat syrup, grenadine & lime juice. I recommend Trader Vic’s brand as Vic is credited with the inception of this great drink.

name: Madras
directions: Fill a highball glass with ice. Add vodka fill with equal parts of cranberry and orange juice.

name: Macua
directions: Fill ¾ of a cocktail shaker with ice and add Flor de Caña rum, guava juice, orange juice, lemon juice and simple sugar. Shake well for 20-30 seconds, serve in a Tom Collins glass with ice and decorate with orange slice and cherry.

name: Lucky Lady
directions: Combine ingredients in a blender with 1 cup ice, blend 15–20 seconds until smooth, and pour into a margarita glass.

name: Lucid Frappe
directions: Add absinthe, simple syrup and fill with crushed ice. Pour mixture into shaker and shake vigorously. Pour contents into glass, top with splash of soda water and garnish with mint sprig. Muddle mint leaves in the bottom of a frappe style glass.

name: Lovin’ in the Coven
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass (don’t shake too hard with a carbonated beverage). Charge with ½ oz Tru Blood beverage.

name: Lover’s Cocktail
directions: Add ingredients to a shaker with ice. Mix gently and serve in two chilled cocktail glasses.

name: Love Letter
directions: Shake. Add Soda. Pour over ice in highball. Garnish with a lime zest.

name: Love Machine
directions: Serve in tall glass and garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Love and Roses
directions: In a mixing glass, muddle lemon and rose petals. Add ice, Plymouth gin, maraschino liqueur and lemon bitters. Shake with ice and strain into a champagne flute. Fill glass with prosecco. Garnish with a fragrant rose petal.

name: Lotus Cocktail
directions: Pre-chill a cocktail glass and set aside. Cut three slices of cucumber into quarters and muddle in a mixing glass with the Canton. When sufficiently pulverized, add Hendrick’s and a level scoop of ice. Shake for about 15 seconds. Strain carefully into pre-chilled glass while being careful to limit the amount of pulp. Add soda to icy, crushed cucumber mixture. Swirl and strain again. Garnish with the remaining cuke slice.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
directions: Combine in a collins glass with ice. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
directions: Build in a collins glass. Top with Coke and garnish with lemon twist.

name: Long Beach Ice Tea
directions: Build in a collins glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Loft Lavender Cello Product Release
directions: Pour liqueur, gin, lime juice and pomegranate juice over ice. Top off with tonic and soda. You could use all soda or all tonic. However, tonic is different than soda because it contains quinine. You can read more about that here.

name: Living Shadow
directions: 1. Muddle grapes in a mixing glass.
2. Add remaining ingredients with ice and shake.
3. Strain into a martini glass.
4. Gently pour a few drops of red wine over the back end of a bar spoon while touching the inside rim of the martini glass to create the red wine float.

name: Little Princess
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Little Princess
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Little Devil
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass over ice. Drop in the cherry.

name: Liquid Candy
directions: Combine the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Limey
directions: Combine ingredients except lime twist in a blender filled with 1 cup ice, blend for 15–20 second until smooth and pour into a chilled red wine glass. Garnish with the lime twist.

name: Lingering Labor Day
directions: Muddle Watermelon and Chili, add remaining ingredients.
Shake and fine strain over fresh ice, garnish with Watermelon.

name: Lijit Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker or mixing glass filled with ice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve. Garnish with lime wheel.

name: Limbo
directions: Combine all ingredients in cocktail shaker with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with the banana slice.

name: Leprechaun
directions: Pour whiskey into a collins glass filled with ice, fill with tonic water, stir gently and drop in the lemon twist.

name: Lifesaver
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Swirl lightly and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Spear cherry with a straw and drop in.

name: Lemonada
directions: Add 2 parts Avión Silver, 4 parts Fresh Lemon Juice and ½ part Agave Nectar into a shaker with ice. Strain the cocktail over a tall glass of ice. Garnish with a lemon wheel and enjoy!

name: Lemon Verbena Spring Fling Cocktail
directions: Muddle the lemon verbena, fresh lemon juice and simple syrup at the bottom of a tall glass (collins glass). Then add the gin. Put crushed ice on top (this not only keeps it cold but also stops the leaves from getting in your mouth). Top off with club soda. Garnish with a slice of lemon.
NOTES:

I tried making lemon verbena simple syrup. It tasted like a high-end throat lozenge. Unless you want a Ricola cocktail, I don’t suggest it. Also, I tried it with another high-quality gin and found that it wasn’t as balanced as when made with Tru2 and we had to add some more lemon and simple syrup to balance the juniper flavor of the gin.

name: Lemon Herb Sparkler
directions: Pour the juice and liqueur in a champagne flute, and top off with chilled sparkling wine. Garnish with a lemon wheel.

name: Lemon Lavender Cocktail
directions: Using your fingers, strip the lavender flowers from the stem and combine with the limoncello and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker. Thoroughly muddle the lavender so that the flowers release their oils into the lemon liquids. Add the gin and shake with ice. Strain into a champagne glass and top with champagne. Garnish with a lavender flower, if desired.

name: Lemon Drop
directions: Moisten the rim of a cocktail glass with a little lemon juice (tip: take a lemon wedge and rim the glass with it) and dip in 1/2 of the sugar to frost. Mix vodka and remaining lemon juice and sugar in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into the cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon slice.

name: Legal Shirley Temple
directions: Build this drink in a tall glass, usually a collins glass, filled with ice. Add a few ounces of vodka, fill with Sprite and add grenadine to your liking. Finally top it all off with a few maraschino cherries.

name: Lava Flow
directions: Combine all ingredients in an electric blender with the a cup ice. Blend 20–30 seconds. Pour strawberry purée into a hurricane or collins glass. Follow with the blended mixture. This creates the flow. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and paper umbrella (of course!)
*Strawberry purée
Ingredients:
2 cups fresh or frozen strawberries
¼ cup sugar
Water, as needed
Directions:
Mash strawberries and sugar together and heat in a sauce pan over medium heat. stir until blended and syrupy, add water if it is too stiff.

name: Leap Year Cocktail
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake, and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Laughter in the Dark
directions: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: La Serena Sour
directions: Shake all ingredients, except for the wine, with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Float the Chilean white wine on top (this can be done by pouring the wine slowly over the back of a barspoon).

name: La Poire Golden Harvest
ingredients: freshly shucked or leftover roasted corn
directions: In a cocktail shaker, place the corn and agave nectar, muddle well. Add ice and the remaining ingredients and shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker is frosted and beaded with sweat. Strain into a martini glass and garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and chili powder.

name: Kurant Imperial Kir
directions: Pour in a champagne glass and stir gently.

name: Kurant Affair
ingredients: Splash club soda or sparkling water
directions: Pour vodka into a collins glass filled with ice, fill the glass almost full with cranberry juice and top with a splash of club soda or sparkling water. Garnish with a lime slice.

name: Kopstootje
directions: Fill the original tulip glass so full with Bols you couldn’t pick it up without spilling. Clasp hands behind your back and lean forward to sip until the meniscus is gone. Pick up the glass and shoot. Follow with a beer back.

name: Kiwi Mint Mango
directions: Fill a highball glass with ice, add mint leaves and kiwi vodka, and top with mango nectar. Stir well and serve.

name: Kiwi Masquerade
directions: In a mixing glass muddle kiwi until pulpy. Add remaining ingredients (use less simple if your kiwi is sweet and slightly more if tart) and give a vigorous dry shake. Add Ice and shake again for 30 seconds. Strain into a V-glass. Garnish with a slice of kiwi.

name: Kir Royale
directions: In a champagne glass, pour. Stir gently.

name: Kiwi Caipiroska
directions: In a mixing glass, muddle the limes with the sugar syrup. Add kiwi vodka, and fill with ice. Shake vigorously, and pour all into a rocks glass.

name: Kir
directions: In a chiled wine glass, add crème de cassis and fill with wine.

name: King Cake Martini
directions: Combine Absolut Citron, pineapple juice and agave nectar in an ice-filled mixing glass. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass rimmed with green sprinkles. Take a bar spoon and drizzle ½ oz Chambord so that it settles at the bottom of the cocktail glass. Serve with a beaded necklace and a smile!

name: Keoki Coffee
directions: Add tequila and sugar to a footed mug. Fill with coffee. Stir well.

name: Kentucky Champagne Cocktail
directions: In a mixing glass with ice, combine whiskey, schnapps and angostura. Strain into a chilled champagne flute. Fill with champagne.

name: Kentucky Cocktail
directions: Combine in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with the cherry.

name: Kangaroo
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with the orange rind.

name: Kamikaze
directions: Kamikaze’s can be enjoyed multiple ways:
Straight up or shot: Use a mixing glass with ice. Mix ingredients well to chill. Strain into a cocktail or shot glass.
On the rocks: Build in a rocks glass with ice.
My favorite: Get 2 pour spouts, one for the vodka and another for a combination of the triple sec and lime juice. Pour directly into the mouth and shake.

name: Kahlúa Peppermint Mocha Hot Chocolate
directions: Bring milk to a simmer. Whisk in drinking chocolate. Simmer for 30 seconds while stirring. Add Kahlúa peppermint mocha liqueur. Garnish with peppermint stick and marshmallows.

name: Kahlúa White Leprechaun
directions: Shake well with ice and strain into a rocks or martini glass. Garnish with fresh mint and vanilla bean.

name: Kahlúa Shake
directions: Combine everything in a blender. Mix on high for 30–45 seconds. Pour into a collins glass. Serve with a straw and long spoon.

name: Kahlúa Peppermint Mocha Espresso Martini
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Kahlúa Mochatini
directions: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Kahlua Hot Chocolate
directions: Prepare the hot chocolate. Add in Kahlúa and liqueur. Stir well. Garnish with a Hershey’s Chocolate Kiss and marshmallow.

name: Kahlúa Cryptini
directions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker with ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a martini glass.

name: Jägermonster
ingredients: Fill a mixing glass with ice. Combine all everything in the mixing glass. Mix well, and serve in a beer mug.
directions: 1 oz Jägermeister
1 oz grenadine
Fill with orange juice

name: Kahlúa Black Cat
directions: Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and stir until chilled. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with three espresso beans.

name: Jump on the BOND Wagon Martini
directions: Stir over ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. No garnish.
(Use less water if using fragile ice.)

name: Jolly Rancher #2
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a shot glass filled with ice.

name: Journalist
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Jolly Rancher #1
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice for a cocktail or into a shot glass for a shooter.

name: Joker’s Tea
directions: In a pint glass filled, pour ingredients then top off with one part sweet and sour and two parts coke. Similar to a long island ice tea, you can adjust the coke for taste.

name: Jelly Bean #2
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into a rocks glass filled with ice for a cocktail or into a shot glass for a shooter.

name: Jimmy Russell’s Mint Julep
ingredients: 3 sprigs of mint (six to eight mature-sized leaves)
directions: In a traditional silver julep cup or double-old fashioned glass, mull two sprigs of mint with the brown sugar and one ounce of Wild Turkey 101 for a few minutes, crushing the mint leaves with a spoon. Add the crushed ice, the rest of the bourbon, and garnish with sprig of mint.

name: Jameson Old Fashioned
directions: Muddle the sugar with the bitters. Add ice and Jameson. Stir until cold (about 20 seconds). Garnish with a fresh orange peel.

name: Jazz
directions: Lemon Twist Jazz Straight Up: Pour the chilled vodka into a chilled martini glass coated in lemon and serve with a twist of lemon.
Jazz on the Rocks: Pour the chilled vodka into a rocks glass coated in lemon filled with ice and serve with a twist of lemon.
To coat the martini glass or rocks glass with lemon, squeeze fresh lemon into the glass, swirl the lemon around the glass until coated (to your liking) and pour out any remaining lemon.

name: Jamaican Winter
directions: Mix rum and ginger ale in a highball glass filled with ice. Squeeze and drop in the lime.

name: Jamaica Me Crazy
directions: Pour rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Fill with pineapple juice and stir.

name: Jade
directions: Combine in a shaker with ice. Mix well and strain into a champagne glass. Fill with champagne. Garnish with a lime squeeze.

name: Jack-O-Latern
directions: Muddle one orange wheel and the mint leaves into a shaking tin. Add ice, Jack Daniels, Simple Syrup and Lemon Juice. Strain into a martini glass. Sink Chambord and garnish with an orange wheel.

name: Jack-o’-Tini
directions: Place a single candy corn at the bottom of chilled cocktail glass. Combine vodka and liqueur a shaker with ice, shake well and strain into the glass.

name: Jack-o’-Lantern Punch
directions: Dissolve the sugar cubes in 1 oz of club soda (this generally involves muddling to help process). Muddle the cloves with the sugar cubes. After the sugar cubes and cloves are muddled/dissolved, add the rest of the ingredients one at a time and stir as added. Add ice once all of the ingredients have been added and stirred. Stir the punch until it is chilled.
Strain the punch into a glass, punch bowl, or carved out pumpkin depending on the size of the portion, top with 2 oz club soda and garnish with apple slices, cinnamon sticks and pumpkin seeds.

name: J.J.’s Shamrock
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake well and strain into a martini glass.

name: Jack-o’-Lantern
directions: Combine all of the ingredients in a cocktail shaker with ice.  Shake vigorously and pour into a goblet glass and garnish with a slice of orange and a mint leaf laid flat on top.
*To make fresh sour, combine ¼ oz fresh lime juice and ¾ oz simple syrup.

name: Italian Stallion
directions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice, stir, and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Italian Sparkling Citrus Punch
directions: Stir all ingredients except the Prosecco together in a glass punch bowl. Cover and refrigerate for two hours. Add the Prosecco and an ice block just before serving.

name: Italian Toddy
directions: Heat apple cider in a pan and our into a footed mug. Add the Tuaca, put a dollop of whipped cream on top, and then add a dash of nutmeg or cinnamon.

name: Italian Coffee
directions: Add amaretto to a coffee cup or footed mug, mix in coffee. Top with whipped cream.

name: Italian Halloween Punch
directions: Combine all the ingredients, except the licorice, in a pitcher. Stir to mix. Pour into glasses and garnish with a stalk of licorice. To serve a larger group, increase the recipe as needed and serve from a punch bowl.

name: Island Holiday Punch
ingredients: Nutmeg and star anise pods for garnish
directions: In a medium sized punch bowl, combine all ingredients except for soda, and whisk lightly. Add 1 solid chunk (or about 3 cups of ice), in addition to soda, and stir. Grate a little nutmeg on top and float 3 star anise pods on surface for garnish. Serves 8.
*Holiday spiced simple syrup:
Ingredients:
1 cup Demerara (turbinado) sugar (white granulated sugar if unavailable)
1 cup water
2 tbsp Jamaican allspice berries (omit if unavailable)
½ tbsp Nutmeg
1 Cinnamon stick
2 Star anise pods
Bring all ingredients to a simmer in saucepan for five minutes. Strain to remove solids and cool. To speed up the cooling, add a few ice cubes to syrup.

NOTE:  To offer simpler option to the Holiday Spiced Simple Syrup, make simple syrup using only water and sugar.  Then, add remaining spices directly to the punch or top it off with Ginger beer instead of soda water.

name: Island Cooler
directions: Fill a hurricane glass with ice. Add white rum and the juices to a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into the Hurricane glass. Float the dark rum on top. Garnish with a pineapple wedge.

name: Irish Spring Cocktail
ingredients: celery juice from 1-2 ribs of celery
directions: Grate the celery ribs into a bowl. Then put the celery in a sieve over the bowl and mash until you get all the juice out of the celery. Juice 2–3 limes for fresh lime juice. Muddle the mint, simple syrup, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Add in the celery juice, gin, and ice. Shake thoroughly for about a minute. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with mint.

name: Irish Tea Punch
directions: Mix ingredients together in a punch bowl, add sparkling water to taste. Float an ice block* in the bowl. Serve in punch cups over ice.
*Easily make an ice block by filling a large plastic container with water and freeze it for 24 hours. Slip into warm water to remove from the container.

name: Irish Monkey
directions: In a shot glass, first pour the Baileys and then the banana liqueur.

name: Irish Sour
ingredients: 2 bar spoons Monin green tea syrup
directions: Shake ingredients over ice and strain into an ice-filled glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: Irish Kiss
directions: Combine in an ice cube-filled collins or specialty glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.

name: Irish Mist Coffee
directions: Stir
into your favorite coffee.
Add 2 sugar cubes if desired. Top with whipped cream.

name: Irish Guy
directions: Pour the Guinness into a pint glass and then drop in the shot of Baileys. Drink very quickly.

name: Irish Flag #2
directions: Create a layered drink by pouring the Grand Marnier into a pony glass, pour the Irish cream slowly over the back of a teaspoon into the pony glass and pour the green crème de menthe slowly over the back of the teaspoon into the pony glass.

name: Irish Kilt
directions: Combine all the ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake well, and strain into a martini glass.

name: Irish Cow
directions: Pour the milk into a coffee mug. Add the whiskey and sugar and stir well.

name: Irish Flag #1
directions: Pour the crème de menthe into a pousse-café glass or a cordial glass. Place a teaspoon on the back of the glass and pour the Baileys Irish cream slowly over the back of the spoon so that it floats on top of the creme de menthe and then pour the brandy slowly over the back of the spoon so that it floats on top.

name: Irish Charlie
directions: Pour the ingredients into a mixing glass half filled with ice. Place a strainer on the top of the glass and swirl the liquor. Serve chilled in a shot glass.

name: Irish Coffee
directions: Pour whiskey and sugar into a footed mug.
Fill with Coffee.
Stir well.
Top with whipped cream

name: Irish Appletini
directions: Shake and strain spirits into a martini glass. Top with ginger ale and garnish with a green apple slice.

name: Irish Buck
directions: Pour whiskey into a highball glass filled with ice, twist the lemon peel over the glass and drop in the glass and fill with ginger ale.

name: Inaugural Orange Punch
directions: Combine in a punch bowl with a large block of ice. Serve in punch cups with a little crushed ice, and give each glass a dash of angostura bitters.
*Mulled orange syrup

Combine 1 cup sugar with 1 cup water and heat to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar. Reduce heat to a low simmer. Add the peel from an orange and mulling spices (a couple of cinnamon sticks, some whole cloves and allspice berries). After 15 minutes, remove from heat and let it sit for several hours. Strain.

name: Independence on Ice
ingredients: Baileys Irish Cream with a Hint of Caramel
directions: Add Baileys Irish Cream, Zacapa rum, allspice dram, and iced coffee to a cocktail shaker full of ice. Shake vigorously until chilled. Strain over fresh ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

name: Irish Apple Sour
directions: Combine all ingredients over ice in a tall glass. Garnish with a lemon wedge.

name: Ignus Fatuus
directions: Shake hard and fine strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Icy Hands Halloween Punch
ingredients:
750 ml bottle premium vodka or white rum
2 liter bottles of lemon lime soda – make sure to get a clear brand
Red food coloring
Marshmallows (optional)
directions: To make icy hand:

Take 2 (always good to have an extra hand) latex gloves, put them on and wash your hands with dish soap. Rinse well and turn the glove inside out so the just washed side is on the inside. Next, fill the gloves with water, tie the end and freeze. Once frozen remove the glove and you are good to go.
To make the punch:

Chill the Vodka (in the freezer) and Soda (in the fridge) for at least 24 hours. Just before the party combine the two liquids in a large punch bowl. Add a few drops of the red food coloring to make it blood red, well maybe more than a few drops. Add one of your icy hands in the center of the bowl, throw in the marshmallows and squirt some more food coloring over all of it for extra bloodiness.

name: Iguana
directions: Combine ingredients in an old fashioned glass filled with ice and stir.

name: Iceberg Martini
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a fresh mint.

name: Iced Mochaccino
directions: Combine ingredients and serve over ice in a tall (collins) glass.

name: Icebreaker
directions: Start with a cup of crushed ice in a blender. Add in all the ingredients. Blend at low speed for 15 seconds. Strain into a highball or white wine glass.

name: Hurricane #2
ingredients: lime juice or sweet & sour mix
directions: This should be made in a hurricane glass, a lantern-shaped footed vessel. If you don’t have one, you can use a bucket or collins glass. Fill any of them with ice. Garnish with a lime squeeze, cherry, pineapple spear and, naturally, a paper umbrella.

name: Ice Pick
directions: Fill a collins glass with ice. Add Vodka and tea, not to much tea!! Squeeze in the lime.

name: Ice and Fire
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well and pour into a tall glass over ice, with or without salt. Garnish with a lime, an olive, a pickled jalapeño and a sprig of cilantro.

name: Hurricane
ingredients: Lime squeeze, cherry, pineapple spear, and paper umbrella (garnish)
directions: This should be made in a hurricane glass, a lantern-shaped footed vessel. If you don’t have one, you can use a bucket or collins glass. Fill any of them with ice. You can also mix in a shaker and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Humid In H-Town
directions: Mix together in shaker, strain over fresh ice into a chilled collins glass, and be prepared to sweat.

name: Hula Hula
directions: Combine ingredients in a shaker filled with ice, shake and strain into a chilled martini or cocktail glass.

name: Hula Hoop
directions: Combine ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice and stir.

name: Hudson Highland Cup
